title: Under the Red Robe

text: There were a score round us when the fool, little knowing the man with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whom he had to deal, and as little how to lose like a gentleman, flung
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the words in my teeth. He thought, I'll be sworn, that I should storm
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and swear and ruffle it like any common cock of the hackle. But that was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: never Gil de Berault's way. For a few seconds after he had spoken I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: did not even look at him. I passed my eye instead--smiling, BIEN
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ENTENDU--round the ring of waiting faces, saw that there was no one
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: except De Pombal I had cause to fear; and then at last I rose and looked
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at the fool with the grim face I have known impose on older and wiser
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: men.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Marked cards, M. l'Anglais?' I said, with a chilling sneer. 'They are
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: used, I am told, to trap players--not unbirched schoolboys.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yet I say that they are marked!' he replied hotly, in his queer foreign
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: jargon. 'In my last hand I had nothing. You doubled the stakes. Bah,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sir, you knew! You have swindled me!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Monsieur is easy to swindle--when he plays with a mirror behind him,' I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answered tartly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: At that there was a great roar of laughter, which might have been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: heard in the street, and which brought to the table everyone in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eating-house whom his voice had not already attracted. But I did not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: relax my face. I waited until all was quiet again, and then waving aside
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: two or three who stood between us and the entrance, I pointed gravely to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the door.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'There is a little space behind the church of St Jacques, M.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: l'Etranger,' I said, putting on my hat and taking my cloak on my arm.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Doubtless you will accompany me thither?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He snatched up his hat, his face burning with shame and rage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'With pleasure!' he blurted out. 'To the devil, if you like!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I thought the matter arranged, when the Marquis laid his hand on the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: young fellow's arm and checked him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'This must not be,' he said, turning from him to me with his grand,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fine-gentleman's air. 'You know me, M. de Berault. This matter has gone
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: far enough.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Too far! M. de Pombal,' I answered bitterly. 'Still, if you wish to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: take your friend's place, I shall raise no objection.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Chut, man!' he retorted, shrugging his shoulders negligently. 'I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: know you, and I do not fight with men of your stamp. Nor need this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gentleman.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Undoubtedly,' I replied, bowing low, 'if he prefers to be caned in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: streets.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: That stung the Marquis.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Have a care! have a care!' he cried hotly. 'You go too far, M.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Berault.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'De Berault, if you please,' I objected, eyeing him sternly. 'My family
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: has borne the DE as long as yours, M. de Pombal.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He could not deny that, and he answered, 'As you please;' at the same
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: time restraining his friend by a gesture. 'But none the less,' he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: continued, 'take my advice. The Cardinal has forbidden duelling, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: this time he means it! You have been in trouble once and gone free.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: A second time it may fare worse with you. Let this gentleman go,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: therefore, M. de Berault. Besides--why, shame upon you, man!' he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: exclaimed hotly; 'he is but a lad!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Two or three who stood behind me applauded that, But I turned and they
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: met my eye; and they were as mum as mice.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'His age is his own concern,' I said grimly. 'He was old enough a while
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ago to insult me.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And I will prove my words!' the lad cried, exploding at last. He had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: spirit enough, and the Marquis had had hard work to restrain him so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: long. 'You do me no service, M. de Pombal,' he continued, pettishly
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shaking off his friend's hand. 'By your leave, this gentleman and I will
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: settle this matter.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is better,' I said, nodding drily, while the Marquis stood aside,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: frowning and baffled. 'Permit me to lead the way.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Zaton's eating-house stands scarcely a hundred paces from St Jacques la
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Boucherie, and half the company went thither with us. The evening was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wet, the light in the streets was waning, the streets themselves were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dirty and slippery. There were few passers in the Rue St Antoine; and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: our party, which earlier in the day must have attracted notice and a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crowd, crossed unmarked, and entered without interruption the paved
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: triangle which lies immediately behind the church. I saw in the distance
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: one of the Cardinal's guard loitering in front of the scaffolding round
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the new Hotel Richelieu; and the sight of the uniform gave me pause for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a moment. But it was too late to repent.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The Englishman began at once to strip off his clothes. I closed mine
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the throat, for the air was chilly. At that moment, while we stood
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: preparing, and most of the company seemed a little inclined to stand off
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from me, I felt a hand on my arm, and turning, saw the dwarfish tailor
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at whose house, in the Rue Savonnerie, I lodged at the time. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fellow's presence was unwelcome, to say the least of it; and though for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: want of better company I had sometimes encouraged him to be free with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me at home, I took that to be no reason why I should be plagued with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him before gentlemen. I shook him off, therefore, hoping by a frown to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: silence him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He was not to be so easily put down, however, and perforce I had to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: speak to him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Afterwards, afterwards,' I said hurriedly. 'I am engaged now.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'For God's sake, don't, sir!' the poor fool cried, clinging to my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sleeve. 'Don't do it! You will bring a curse on the house. He is but a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lad, and--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You, too!' I exclaimed, losing patience. 'Be silent, you scum! What do
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: you know about gentlemen's quarrels? Leave me; do you hear?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But the Cardinal!' he cried in a quavering voice. 'The Cardinal, M. de
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Berault! The last man you killed is not forgotten yet. This time he will
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be sure to--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Leave me, do you hear?' I hissed. The fellow's impudence passed all
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bounds. It was as bad as his croaking. 'Begone!' I added. 'I suppose you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: are afraid that he will kill me, and you will lose your money.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Frison fell back at that almost as if I had struck him, and I turned
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to my adversary, who had been awaiting my motions with impatience. God
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: knows he did look young as he stood with his head bare and his fair hair
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: drooping over his smooth woman's forehead--a mere lad fresh from the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: college of Burgundy, if they have such a thing in England. I felt a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sudden chill as I looked at him: a qualm, a tremor, a presentiment. What
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was it the little tailor had said? That I should--but there, he did not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: know. What did he know of such things? If I let this pass I must kill a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: man a day, or leave Paris and the eating-house, and starve.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'A thousand pardons,' I said gravely, as I drew and took my place. 'A
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dun. I am sorry that the poor devil caught me so inopportunely. Now
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: however, I am at your service.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He saluted and we crossed swords and began. But from the first I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: no doubt what the result would be. The slippery stones and fading
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: light gave him, it is true, some chance, some advantage, more than he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: deserved; but I had no sooner felt his blade than I knew that he was no
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swordsman. Possibly he had taken half-a-dozen lessons in rapier art,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and practised what he learned with an Englishman as heavy and awkward
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as himself. But that was all. He made a few wild clumsy rushes, parrying
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: widely. When I had foiled these, the danger was over, and I held him at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my mercy.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I played with him a little while, watching the sweat gather on his brow
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and the shadow of the church tower fall deeper and darker, like the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shadow of doom, on his face. Not out of cruelty--God knows I have never
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: erred in that direction!--but because, for the first time in my life,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I felt a strange reluctance to strike the blow. The curls clung to his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forehead; his breath came and went in gasps; I heard the men behind me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and one or two of them drop an oath; and then I slipped--slipped, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was down in a moment on my right side, my elbow striking the pavement so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sharply that the arm grew numb to the wrist.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He held off. I heard a dozen voices cry, 'Now! now you have him!' But he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: held off. He stood back and waited with his breast heaving and his point
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lowered, until I had risen and stood again on my guard.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Enough! enough!' a rough voice behind me cried. 'Don't hurt the man
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: after that.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'On guard, sir!' I answered coldly--for he seemed to waver, and be in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: doubt. 'It was an accident. It shall not avail you again.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Several voices cried 'Shame!' and one, 'You coward!' But the Englishman
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stepped forward, a fixed look in his blue eyes. He took his place
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: without a word. I read in his drawn white face that he had made up his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mind to the worst, and his courage so won my admiration that I would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gladly and thankfully have set one of the lookers-on--any of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lookers-on--in his place; but that could not be. So I thought of Zaton's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: closed to me, of Pombal's insult, of the sneers and slights I had long
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: kept at the sword's point; and, pressing him suddenly in a heat of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: affected anger, I thrust strongly over his guard, which had grown
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: feeble, and ran him through the chest.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: When I saw him lying, laid out on the stones with his eyes half shut,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and his face glimmering white in the dusk--not that I saw him thus long,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for there were a dozen kneeling round him in a twinkling--I felt an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unwonted pang. It passed, however, in a moment. For I found myself
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: confronted by a ring of angry faces--of men who, keeping at a distance,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hissed and cursed and threatened me, calling me Black Death and the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: like.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: They were mostly canaille, who had gathered during the fight, and had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: viewed all that passed from the farther side of the railings. While
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: some snarled and raged at me like wolves, calling me 'Butcher!' and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Cut-throat!' or cried out that Berault was at his trade again, others
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: threatened me with the vengeance of the Cardinal, flung the edict in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: teeth, and said with glee that the guard were coming--they would see me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hanged yet.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'His blood is on your head!' one cried furiously. 'He will be dead in an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hour. And you will swing for him! Hurrah!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Begone,' I said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ay, to Montfaucon,' he answered, mocking me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No; to your kennel!' I replied, with a look which sent him a yard
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: backwards, though the railings were between us. And I wiped my blade
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: carefully, standing a little apart. For--well, I could understand it--it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was one of those moments when a man is not popular. Those who had come
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with me from the eating-house eyed me askance, and turned their backs
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: when I drew nearer; and those who had joined us and obtained admission
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: were scarcely more polite.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I was not to be outdone in SANG FROID. I cocked my hat, and drawing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my cloak over my shoulders, went out with a swagger which drove the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: curs from the gate before I came within a dozen paces of it. The rascals
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: outside fell back as quickly, and in a moment I was in the street.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Another moment and I should have been clear of the place and free to lie
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by for a while--when, without warning, a scurry took place round me. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crowd fled every way into the gloom, and in a hand-turn a dozen of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cardinal's guards closed round me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had some acquaintance with the officer in command, and he saluted me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: civilly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'This is a bad business, M. de Berault,' he said. 'The man is dead they
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: tell me.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Neither dying nor dead,' I answered lightly. 'If that be all you may go
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: home again.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'With you,' he replied, with a grin, 'certainly. And as it rains, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sooner the better. I must ask you for your sword, I am afraid.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Take it,' I said, with the philosophy which never deserts me. 'But the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: man will not die.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I hope that may avail you,' he answered in a tone I did not like. 'Left
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wheel, my friends! To the Chatelet! March!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'There are worse places,' I said, and resigned myself to fate. After
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all, I had been in a prison before, and learned that only one jail lets
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: no prisoner escape.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But when I found that my friend's orders were to hand me over to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: watch, and that I was to be confined like any common jail-bird caught
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cutting a purse or slitting a throat, I confess my heart sank. If I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: could get speech with the Cardinal, all would probably be well; but if
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I failed in this, or if the case came before him in strange guise, or if
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he were in a hard mood himself, then it might go ill with me. The edict
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said, death!
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: that you will need strategy, and good strategy. They suspect everybody.

text: CHAPTER II. AT THE GREEN PILLAR
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cocheforet lies in a billowy land of oak and beech and chestnuts--a land
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of deep, leafy bottoms and hills clothed with forest. Ridge and valley,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: glen and knoll, the woodland, sparsely peopled and more sparsely tilled,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stretches away to the great snow mountains that here limit France. It
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swarms with game--with wolves and bears, deer and boars. To the end of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his life I have heard that the great king loved this district, and would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sigh, when years and State fell heavily on him, for the beech groves and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: box-covered hills of South Bearn. From the terraced steps of Auch you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: can see the forest roll away in light and shadow, vale and upland, to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the base of the snow peaks; and, though I come from Brittany and love
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the smell of the salt wind, I have seen few sights that outdo this.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was the second week of October, when I came to Cocheforet, and,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dropping down from the last wooded brow, rode quietly into the place at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: evening. I was alone, and had ridden all day in a glory of ruddy beech
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: leaves, through the silence of forest roads, across clear brooks and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: glades still green. I had seen more of the quiet and peace of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: country than had been my share since boyhood, and for that reason, or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: because I had no great taste for the task before me--the task now
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so imminent--I felt a little hipped. In good faith, it was not a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gentleman's work that I was come to do, look at it how you might.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But beggars must not be choosers, and I knew that this feeling would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not last. At the inn, in the presence of others, under the spur of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: necessity, or in the excitement of the chase, were that once begun, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: should lose the feeling. When a man is young he seeks solitude, when he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: is middle-aged, he flies it and his thoughts. I made therefore for the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Green Pillar,' a little inn in the village street, to which I had been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: directed at Auch, and, thundering on the door with the knob of my riding
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: switch, railed at the man for keeping me waiting.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Here and there at hovel doors in the street--which was a mean,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: poor place, not worthy of the name--men and women looked out at me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: suspiciously. But I affected to ignore them; and at last the host came.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He was a fair-haired man, half-Basque, half-Frenchman, and had scanned
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: portent in that out-of-the-way village--but eyed me with a kind of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sullen reserve.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sorrel's neck. The horse hung its head.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I don't know,' he answered stupidly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: door.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'This is an inn, is it not?' I said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But you are full, or you are out of food, or your wife is ill, or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: something else is amiss,' I answered peevishly. 'All the same, I am
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: too--if you have one.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his beast, and wherever I go I see my horse fed.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: stubbornly.
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You have no other guests?' I said, with a casual air. I knew that he
title: Under the Red Robe

text: was watching me closely.
title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: 'No.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: come. The cottages, which were no more than mean, small huts, ran in
title: Under the Red Robe

text: a straggling double line, with many gaps--through fallen trees and
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: place, lacking a chimney or glazed windows, and grimy with smoke and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: use. The fire--a great half-burned tree--smouldered on a stone hearth,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: raised a foot from the floor. A huge black pot simmered over it, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: down to wait for my supper.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was heartily glad when it was over, and I found myself, at last, left
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: alone for the night in a little garret--a mere fowl-house--upstairs,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: formed by the roof and gable walls, and hung with strings of apples and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: chestnuts. It was a poor sleeping-place--rough, chilly, and unclean. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ascended to it by a ladder; my cloak and a little fern formed my only
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bed. But I was glad to accept it, for it enabled me to be alone and to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: think out the position unwatched.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Of course M. de Cocheforet was at the Chateau. He had left his horse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: here, and gone up on foot; probably that was his usual plan. He was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: therefore within my reach, in one sense--I could not have come at a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: better time--but in another he was as much beyond it as if I were still
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in Paris. For so far was I from being able to seize him that I dared not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ask a question, or let fall a rash word, or even look about me freely.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I saw I dared not. The slightest hint of my mission, the faintest breath
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of distrust, would lead to throat-cutting--and the throat would be mine;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while the longer I lay in the village, the greater suspicion I should
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: incur, and the closer would be the watch kept upon me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In such a position some men might have given up the attempt in despair,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and saved themselves across the border. But I have always valued myself
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: on my fidelity, and I did not shrink. If not to-day, to-morrow; if
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not this time, next time. The dice do not always turn up aces. Bracing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: myself, therefore, to the occasion, I crept, as soon as the house was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: quiet, to the window, a small, square, open lattice, much cobwebbed, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: partly stuffed with hay. I looked out. The village seemed to be asleep.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The dark branches of trees hung a few feet away, and almost obscured
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a grey, cloudy sky, through which a wet moon sailed drearily. Looking
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: downwards, I could at first see nothing; but as my eyes grew used to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: darkness--I had only just put out my rushlight--I made out the stable
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: door and the shadowy outlines of the lean-to roof.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had hoped for this, for I could now keep watch, and learn at least
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whether Cocheforet left before morning. If he did not, I should know
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he was still here. If he did, I should be the better for seeing his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: features, and learning, perhaps, other things that might be of use to me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in the future.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Making up my mind to the uncomfortable, I sat down on the floor by the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lattice, and began a vigil that might last, I knew, until morning. It
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: did last about an hour, at the end of which time I heard whispering
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: below, then footsteps; then, as some persons turned a corner, a voice
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: speaking aloud and carelessly. I could not catch the words or meaning,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: but the voice was a gentleman's, and its bold accents and masterful
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: tone left me in no doubt that the speaker was M. de Cocheforet himself.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Hoping to learn more, I pressed my face nearer to the opening, and had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: just made out through the gloom two figures--one that of a tall, slight
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: man, wearing a cloak, the other, I fancied, a woman's, in a sheeny white
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dress--when a thundering rap on the door of my garret made me spring
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: back a yard from the lattice, and lie down hurriedly on my couch. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: summons was repeated.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well?' I cried, rising on my elbow, and cursing the untimely
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: interruption. I was burning with anxiety to see more. 'What is it? What
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: is the matter?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The trap-door was lifted a foot or more. The landlord thrust up his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: head.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You called, did you not?' he said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He held up a rushlight, which illumined half the room and lit up his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: grinning face.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Called--at this hour of the night, you fool?' I answered angrily. 'No!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I did not call. Go to bed, man!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But he remained on the ladder, gaping stupidly. 'I heard you,' he said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Go to bed! You are drunk,' I answered, sitting up. 'I tell you I did
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not call.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Oh, very well,' he answered slowly. 'And you do not want anything?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Nothing--except to be left alone,' I replied sourly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Umph!' he said. 'Good-night!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Good-night! Good-night!' I answered with what patience I might. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: tramp of the horse's hoofs as it was led out of the stable was in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ears at the moment. 'Good-night!' I continued feverishly, hoping that he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would still retire in time, and I have a chance to look out. 'I want to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sleep.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Good,' he said, with a broad grin. 'But it is early yet, and you have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: plenty of time.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And then, at last, he slowly let down the trap-door, and I heard him
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: chuckle as he went down the ladder.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Before he reached the bottom I was at the window. The woman, whom I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seen, still stood below in the same place, and beside her was a man in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a peasant's dress, holding a lanthorn. But the man, the man I wanted
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to see, was no longer there. He was gone, and it was evident that the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: others no longer feared me; for while I gazed the landlord came out to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: them with another lanthorn swinging in his hand, and said something to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the lady, and she looked up at my window and laughed.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was a warm night, and she wore nothing over her white dress. I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: see her tall, shapely figure and shining eyes, and the firm contour of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her beautiful face, which, if any fault might be found with it, erred
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in being too regular. She looked like a woman formed by nature to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: meet dangers and difficulties, and to play a great part; even here, at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: midnight, in the midst of these desperate men, she did not seem out of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: place. I could fancy--I did not find it impossible to fancy--that under
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her queenly exterior, and behind the contemptuous laugh with which she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: heard the landlord's story, there lurked a woman's soul, a soul capable
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of folly and tenderness. But no outward sign betrayed its presence--as I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: saw her then.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I scanned her very carefully; and secretly, if the truth be told, I was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: glad to find that Madame de Cocheforet was such a woman. I was glad that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she had laughed as she had--with a ring of disdain and defiance; glad
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that she was not a little, tender, child-like woman, to be crushed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by the first pinch of trouble. For if I succeeded in my task, if I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: contrived to--but, pish! Women, I told myself, were all alike. She would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: find consolation quickly enough.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I watched until the group broke up, and Madame, with one of the men,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: went her way round the corner of the inn, and out of my sight. Then I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: retired to bed again, feeling more than ever perplexed what course I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: should adopt. It was clear that to succeed I must obtain admission to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the house, which was garrisoned, according to my instructions, by two
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: or three old men-servants only, and as many women; since Madame, to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: disguise her husband's visits the more easily, lived, and gave out that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she lived, in great retirement. To seize her husband at home, therefore,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might be no impossible task; though here, in the heart of the village, a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: troop of horse might make the attempt, and fail.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But how was I to gain admission to the house--a house guarded by
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: quick-witted women, and fenced with all the precautions love could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: devise? That was the question; and dawn found me still debating it,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: still as far as ever from an answer. Anxious and feverish, I was glad
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: when the light came, and I could get up. I thought that the fresh
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: air might inspire me, and I was tired of my stuffy closet. I crept
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stealthily down the ladder, and managed to pass unseen through the lower
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: room, in which several persons were snoring heavily. The outer door was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not fastened, and in a hand-turn I was in the street.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was still so early that the trees stood up black against the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: reddening sky, but the bough upon the post before the door was growing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: green, and in a few minutes the grey light would be everywhere. Already,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: even in the roadway, there was a glimmering of it; and as I stood at the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: corner of the house--where I could command both the front and the side
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: on which the stable opened--sniffing the fresh air, and looking for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: light-coloured lying on the ground. It was not more than two or three
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: paces from me, and I stepped to it and picked it up curiously, hoping
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: worked in white silk; and was altogether a dainty little toy, such as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: women love.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Doubtless Madame de Cocheforet had dropped it in the night. I turned it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: over and over; and then I put it in my pouch with a smile, thinking that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it might be useful sometime, and in some way. I had scarcely done this,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and turned with the intention of exploring the street, when the door
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at my elbow, and gave me a surly greeting.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: managed to be with me, on one pretence or another until noon. Moreover,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his manner grew each moment more churlish, his hints plainer; until
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the point by asking me rudely if I did not need my horse.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No,' I said. 'Why do you ask?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: place for strangers.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ah!' I retorted. 'But the border air suits me, you see,'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was a lucky answer, for, taken with my talk the night before, it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: puzzled him, by suggesting that I was on the losing side, and had my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: over it, the clatter of hoofs broke the sleepy quiet of the village
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: street, and the lady I had seen the night before rode quickly round the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: twinkling was hidden by a house. Two or three glum-looking fellows
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her. Two minutes walking at speed brought me to a light wooden bridge
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: spanning a stream. I crossed this, and, as the wood opened, saw before
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me first a wide, pleasant meadow, and beyond this a terrace. On the

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Short as had been my absence, however, I found things altered there.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Round the door lounged three strangers--stout, well-armed fellows, whose
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before them, and, particularly, that I might refer to the previous

text: who hate him!'

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'MON DIEU!' one of the strangers cried, springing from his seat in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a rage. 'I am not going to stomach that! Is your house a common
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: treason-hole,' he continued, turning furiously on the landlord, 'that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: you suffer this?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hoity-toity!' I answered, coolly keeping my seat. 'What is all this?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Don't you relish my toast, little man?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No--nor you!' he retorted hotly; 'whoever you may be!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then I will give you another,' I answered, with a hiccough. 'Perhaps it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: will be more to your taste. Here is the Duke of Orleans, and may he soon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be King!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: CHAPTER III. THE HOUSE IN THE WOOD
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Words so reckless fairly shook the three men out of their anger. For
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a moment they glared at me as if they had seen a ghost. Then the wine
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: merchant clapped his hand on the table.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is enough,' he said, with a look at his companions. 'I think that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: there can be no mistake about that. As damnable treason as ever I heard
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whispered! I congratulate you, sir, on your boldness. As for you,' he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: continued, turning with an ugly sneer to the landlord, 'I shall know now
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the company you keep! I was not aware that my wine wet whistles to such
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a tune!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But if he was startled, the innkeeper was furious, seeing his character
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thus taken away; and, being at no time a man of many words, he vented
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his rage exactly in the way I wished, raising in a twinkling such an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: uproar as can scarcely be conceived. With a roar like a bull's, he ran
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: headlong at the table, and overturned it on the top of me. Fortunately
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the woman saved the lamp, and fled with it into a corner, whence she and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the man from the Chateau watched the skirmish in silence; but the pewter
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cups and platters flew spinning across the floor, while the table
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pinned me to the ground among the ruins of my stool. Having me at this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: disadvantage--for at first I made no resistance the landlord began to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: belabour me with the first thing he snatched up, and when I tried to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: defend myself, cursed me with each blow for a treacherous rogue and a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: vagrant. Meanwhile the three merchants, delighted with the turn things
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had taken, skipped round us laughing, and now hounded him on, now
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: traitor?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: When I thought that this had lasted long enough--or, to speak more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: plainly, when I could stand the innkeeper's drubbing no longer--I threw
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him off, and struggled to my feet; but still, though the blood was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: trickling down my face, I refrained from drawing my sword. I caught
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: up instead a leg of the stool which lay handy, and, watching my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him out in a moment on the wreck of his own table.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: nicety, 'come on! Come on! if you dare to strike a blow, you peddling,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: truckling, huckstering knaves! A fig for you and your shaveling
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cardinal!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The red-faced wine merchant drew his sword in a one-two.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Why, you drunken fool,' he said wrathfully, 'put that stick down, or I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: will spit you like a lark!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Lark in your teeth!' I cried, staggering as if the wine were in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: head. 'And cuckoo, too! Another word, and I--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He made a couple of savage passes at me, but in a twinkling his sword
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: flew across the room.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'VOILA!' I shouted, lurching forward, as if I had luck and not skill
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to thank for my victory. 'Now, the next! Come on, come on--you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: white-livered knaves!' And, pretending a drunken frenzy, I flung my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: weapon bodily amongst them, and seizing the nearest, began to wrestle
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In a moment they all threw themselves upon me, and, swearing copiously,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bore me back to the door. The wine merchant cried breathlessly to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the woman to open it, and in a twinkling they had me through it, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: half-way across the road. The one thing I feared was a knife-thrust in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the MELEE; but I had to run that risk, and the men were honest, and,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thinking me drunk, indulgent. In a trice I found myself on my back in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the dirt, with my head humming; and heard the bars of the door fall
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: noisily into their places.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I got up and went to the door, and, to play out my part, hammered on it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: frantically; crying out to them to let me in. But the three travellers
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: only jeered at me, and the landlord, coming to the window, with his head
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bleeding, shook his fist at me, and cursed me for a mischief-maker.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Baffled in this, I retired to a log which lay in the road a few paces
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from the house, and sat down on it to await events. With torn clothes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and bleeding face, hatless and covered with dirt, I was in little better
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: case than my opponent. It was raining, too, and the dripping branches
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swayed over my head. The wind was in the south--the coldest quarter.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I began to feel chilled and dispirited. If my scheme failed, I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forfeited roof and bed to no purpose, and placed future progress out of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the question. It was a critical moment.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But at last that happened for which I had been looking. The door swung
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: open a few inches, and a man came noiselessly out; it was quickly barred
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: behind him. He stood a moment, waiting on the threshold and peering
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: into the gloom; and seemed to expect to be attacked. Finding himself
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unmolested, however, and all quiet, he went off steadily down the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: street--towards the Chateau.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I let a couple of minutes go by, and then I followed. I had no
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: difficulty in hitting on the track at the end of the street, but when
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had once plunged into the wood, I found myself in darkness so intense
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that I soon strayed from the path, and fell over roots, and tore my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: clothes with thorns, and lost my temper twenty times before I found
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the path again. However, I gained the bridge at last, and thence caught
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sight of a light twinkling before me. To make for it across the meadow
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and terrace was an easy task; yet, when I had reached the door and had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hammered upon it, I was so worn out, and in so sorry a plight that I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sank down, and had little need to play a part, or pretend to be worse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: than I was.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: For a long time no one answered. The dark house towering above me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: remained silent. I could hear, mingled with the throbbings of my heart,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the steady croaking of the frogs in a pond near the stables; but no
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: other sound. In a frenzy of impatience and disgust, I stood up again and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hammered, kicking with my heels on the nail-studded door, and crying out
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: desperately,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'A MOI! A MOI!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Then, or a moment later, I heard a remote door opened; footsteps as of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more than one person drew near. I raised my voice and cried again,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'A MOI!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Who is there?' a voice asked.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'A gentleman in distress,' I answered piteously, moving my hands across
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the door. 'For God's sake open and let me in. I am hurt, and dying of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cold.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What brings you here?' the voice asked sharply. Despite its tartness, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fancied that it was a woman's.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Heaven knows!' I answered desperately. 'I cannot tell. They maltreated
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me at the inn, and threw me into the street. I crawled away, and have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: been wandering in the wood for hours. Then I saw a light here.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On that some muttering took place on the other side of the door--to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which I had my ear. It ended in the bars being lowered. The door swung
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: partly open, and a light shone out, dazzling me. I tried to shade my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eyes with my fingers, and, as did so, fancied I heard a murmur of pity.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But when I looked in under screen of my hand, I saw only one person--the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: man who held the light, and his aspect was so strange, so terrifying,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that, shaken as I was by fatigue, I recoiled a step.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He was a tall and very thin man, meanly dressed in a short, scanty
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: jacket and well-darned hose. Unable, for some reason, to bend his neck,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he carried his head with a strange stiffness.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And that head--never did living man show a face so like death. His
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forehead was bald and yellow, his cheek-bones stood out under the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: strained skin, all the lower part of his face fell in, his jaws receded,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his cheeks were hollow, his lips and chin were thin and fleshless. He
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seemed to have only one expression--a fixed grin.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: While I stood looking at this formidable creature, he made a quick
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: movement to shut the door again, smiling more widely. I had the presence
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of mind to thrust in my foot, and, before he could resent the act, a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: voice in the background cried,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'For shame, Clon! Stand back, stand back! do you hear? I am afraid,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Monsieur, that you are hurt.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Those words were my welcome to that house; and, spoken at an hour and in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: circumstances so gloomy, they made a lasting impression. Round the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hall ran a gallery, and this, the height of the apartment, and the dark
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: panelling seemed to swallow up the light. I stood within the entrance
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: (as it seemed to me) of a huge cave; the skull-headed porter had the air
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of an ogre. Only the voice which greeted me dispelled the illusion. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: turned trembling towards the quarter whence it came, and, shading my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eyes, made out a woman's form standing in a doorway under the gallery. A
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: second figure, which I took to be that of the servant I had seen at the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: inn, loomed uncertainly beside her.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I bowed in silence. My teeth were chattering. I was faint without
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: feigning, and felt a kind of terror, hard to explain, at the sound of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: this woman's voice.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'One of our people has told me about you, she continued, speaking out of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the darkness. 'I am sorry that this has happened to you here, but I am
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: afraid that you were indiscreet.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I take all the blame, Madame,' I answered humbly. 'I ask only shelter
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for the night.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'The time has not yet come when we cannot give our friends that!' she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answered with noble courtesy. 'When it does, Monsieur, we shall be
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: homeless ourselves.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I shivered, looking anywhere but at her; for, if the truth be told,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had not sufficiently pictured this scene of my arrival--I had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: foredrawn its details; and now I took part in it I felt a miserable
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: meanness weigh me down. I had never from the first liked the work, but I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had had no choice, and I had no choice now. Luckily, the guise in which
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I came, my fatigue, and wound were a sufficient mask, or I should have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: incurred suspicion at once. For I am sure that if ever in this world a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: brave man wore a hang-dog air, or Gil de Berault fell below himself,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it was then and there--on Madame de Cocheforet's threshold, with her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: welcome sounding in my ears.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: One, I think, did suspect me. Clon, the porter, continued to hold the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: door obstinately ajar and to eye me with grinning spite, until his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mistress, with some sharpness, bade him drop the bars and conduct me to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a room.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Do you go also, Louis,' she continued, speaking to the man beside her,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'and see this gentleman comfortably disposed. I am sorry,' she added,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: addressing me in the graceful tone she had before used, and I thought
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that I could see her head bend in the darkness, 'that our present
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: circumstances do not permit us to welcome you more fitly, Monsieur. But
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the troubles of the times--however, you will excuse what is lacking.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Until to-morrow, I have the honour to bid you good-night.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Good-night, Madame,' I stammered, trembling. I had not been able to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: distinguish her face in the gloom of the doorway, but her voice, her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: greeting, her presence unmanned me. I was troubled and perplexed; I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had not spirit to kick a dog. I followed the two servants from the hall
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: without heeding how we went; nor was it until we came to a full stop
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at a door in a white-washed corridor, and it was forced upon me that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: something was in question between my two conductors that I began to take
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: notice.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Then I saw that one of them, Louis, wished to lodge me here where we
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood. The porter, on the other hand, who held the keys, would not. He
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: did not speak a word, nor did the other--and this gave a queer ominous
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: character to the debate; but he continued to jerk his head towards the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: farther end of the corridor; and, at last, he carried his point. Louis
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shrugged his shoulders, and moved on, glancing askance at me; and I, not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: understanding the matter in debate, followed the pair in silence.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We reached the end of the corridor, and there for an instant the monster
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with the keys paused and grinned at me. Then he turned into a narrow
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: passage on the left, and after following it for some paces, halted
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before a small, strong door. His key jarred in the lock, but he forced
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it shrieking round, and with a savage flourish threw the door open.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I walked in and saw a mean, bare chamber with barred windows. The floor
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was indifferently clean, there was no furniture. The yellow light of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the lanthorn falling on the stained walls gave the place the look of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a dungeon. I turned to the two men. 'This is not a very good room,' I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said. 'And it feels damp. Have you no other?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Louis looked doubtfully at his companion. But the porter shook his head
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stubbornly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Why does he not speak?' I asked with impatience.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He is dumb,' Louis answered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Dumb!' I exclaimed. 'But he hears.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He has ears,' the servant answered drily. 'But he has no tongue,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Monsieur.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I shuddered. 'How did he lose it?' I asked.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'At Rochelle. He was a spy, and the king's people took him the day the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: town surrendered. They spared his life, but cut out his tongue.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ah!' I said. I wished to say more, to be natural, to show myself at my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ease. But the porter's eyes seemed to burn into me, and my own tongue
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: clave to the roof of my mouth. He opened his lips and pointed to his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: throat with a horrid gesture, and I shook my head and turned from
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him--'You can let me have some bedding?' I murmured hastily, for the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sake of saying something, and to escape.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: of thoughts. In Clon's presence, or when some word of Madame's,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unconsciously harsh, reminded me of the distance between us, I was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: myself. At other times, in face of this peaceful and intimate life,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which was only rendered possible by the remoteness of the place and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the peculiar circumstances in which the ladies stood, I felt a strange
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: only here and there afforded a distant glimpse of snow-clad peaks; the
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On the fourth day after my coming, however, something happened to break
