author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the spell. It chanced that I came late to dinner, and entered the room
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hastily and without ceremony, expecting to find Madame and her sister
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: already seated. Instead, I found them talking in a low tone by the open
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: door, with every mark of disorder in their appearance; while Clon and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Louis stood at a little distance with downcast faces and perplexed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: looks.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had time to see all this, and then my entrance wrought a sudden
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: change. Clon and Louis sprang to attention; Madame and her sister came
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the table and sat down, and all made a shallow pretence of being at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: their ease. But Mademoiselle's face was pale, her hand trembled; and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: though Madame's greater self-command enabled her to carry off the matter
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: better, I saw that she was not herself. Once or twice she spoke harshly
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to Louis; she fell at other times into a brown study; and when she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thought that I was not watching her, her face wore a look of deep
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: anxiety.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I wondered what all this meant; and I wondered more when, after the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: meal, the two walked in the garden for an hour with Clon. Mademoiselle
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: came from this interview alone, and I was sure that she had been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: weeping. Madame and the dark porter stayed outside some time longer;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: then she, too, came in, and disappeared.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Clon did not return with her, and when I went into the garden five
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: minutes later, Louis also had vanished. Save for two women who sat
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sewing at an upper window, the house seemed to be deserted. Not a sound
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: broke the afternoon stillness of room or garden, and yet I felt that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to grow curious--suspicious, and presently slipped out myself by way of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the stables, and skirting the wood at the back of the house, gained
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with a little trouble the bridge which crossed the stream and led to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: village.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Turning round at this point I could see the house, and I moved a little
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: aside into the underwood, and stood gazing at the windows, trying to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unriddle the matter. It was not likely that M. de Cocheforet would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: repeat his visit so soon; and, besides, the women's emotions had been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: those of pure dismay and grief, unmixed with any of the satisfaction
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to which such a meeting, though snatched by stealth, must give rise.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I discarded my first thought therefore--that he had returned
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unexpectedly--and I sought for another solution.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But no other was on the instant forthcoming. The windows remained
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: obstinately blind, no figures appeared on the terrace, the garden lay
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: deserted, and without life. My departure had not, as I half expected it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would, drawn the secret into light.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I watched awhile, at times cursing my own meanness; but the excitement
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the moment and the quest tided me over that. Then I determined to go
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: down into the village and see whether anything was moving there. I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: been down to the inn once, and had been received half sulkily, half
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: courteously, as a person privileged at the great house, and therefore
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to be accepted. It would not be thought odd if I went again, and after a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moment's thought, I started down the track.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: This, where it ran through the wood, was so densely shaded that the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sun penetrated to it little, and in patches only. A squirrel stirred
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at times, sliding round a trunk, or scampering across the dry leaves.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Occasionally a pig grunted and moved farther into the wood. But the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: place was very quiet, and I do not know how it was that I surprised Clon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: instead of being surprised by him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He was walking along the path before me with his eyes on the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ground--walking so slowly, and with his lean frame so bent that I might
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have supposed him ill if I had not remarked the steady movement of his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: head from right to left, and the alert touch with which he now and again
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: displaced a clod of earth or a cluster of leaves. By-and-by he rose
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stiffly, and looked round him suspiciously; but by that time I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: slipped behind a trunk, and was not to be seen; and after a brief
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: interval he went back to his task, stooping over it more closely, if
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: possible, than before, and applying himself with even greater care.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: By that time I had made up my mind that he was tracking someone. But
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whom? I could not make a guess at that. I only knew that the plot was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thickening, and began to feel the eagerness of the chase. Of course, if
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the matter had not to do with Cocheforet, it was no affair of mine; but
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: though it seemed unlikely that anything could bring him back so soon,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he might still be at the bottom of this. And, besides, I felt a natural
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: curiosity. When Clon at last improved his pace, and went on to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: village, I took up his task. I called to mind all the wood-lore I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ever learned, and scanned trodden mould and crushed leaves with eager
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eyes. But in vain. I could make nothing of it all, and rose at last with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: an aching back and no advantage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I did not go on to the village after that, but returned to the house,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: where I found Madame pacing the garden. She looked up eagerly on hearing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my step; and I was mistaken if she was not disappointed--if she had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: been expecting someone else. She hid the feeling bravely, however, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: met me with a careless word; but she turned to the house more than once
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while we talked, and she seemed to be all the while on the watch, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: uneasy. I was not surprised when Clon's figure presently appeared in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the doorway, and she left me abruptly, and went to him. I only felt more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: certain than before that there was something strange on foot. What it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was, and whether it had to do with M. de Cocheforet, I could not tell.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But there it was, and I grew more curious the longer I remained alone.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She came back to me presently, looking thoughtful and a trifle downcast.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That was Clon, was it not?' I said, studying her face.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes,' she answered. She spoke absently, and did not look at me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'How does he talk to you?' I asked, speaking a trifle curtly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: As I intended, my tone roused her. 'By signs,' she said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Is he--is he not a little mad?' I ventured. I wanted to make her talk
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and forget herself.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She looked at me with sudden keenness, then dropped her eyes.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You do not like him?' she said, a note of challenge in her voice. 'I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have noticed that, Monsieur.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I think he does not like me,' I replied.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He is less trustful than we are,' she answered naively. 'It is natural
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that he should be. He has seen more of the world.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: That silenced me for a moment, but she did not seem to notice it.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I was looking for him a little while ago, and I could not find him,' I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said, after a pause.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He has been into the village,' she answered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I longed to pursue the matter further; but though she seemed to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: entertain no suspicion of me, I dared not run the risk. I tried her,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: instead, on another tack.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Mademoiselle de Cocheforet does not seem very well to-day?' I said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No?' she answered carelessly. 'Well, now you speak of it, I do not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: think that she is. She is often anxious about--one we love.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She uttered the last words with a little hesitation, and looked at me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: quickly when she had spoken them. We were sitting at the moment on a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stone seat which had the wall of the house for a back; and, fortunately,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was toying with the branch of a creeping plant that hung over it, so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that she could not see more than the side of my face. For I knew that it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: altered. Over my voice, however, I had more control, and I hastened to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answer, 'Yes, I suppose so,' as innocently as possible.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He is at Bosost, in Spain. You knew that, I conclude?' she said, with a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: certain sharpness. And she looked me in the face again very directly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes,' I answered, beginning to tremble.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I suppose you have heard, too, that he--that he sometimes crosses
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the border?' she continued in a low voice, but with a certain ring of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: insistence in her tone. 'Or, if you have not heard it, you guess it?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was in a quandary, and grew, in one second, hot all over. Uncertain
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: what amount of knowledge I ought to admit, I took refuge in gallantry.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I should be surprised if he did not,' I answered, with a bow, 'being,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as he is, so close, and having such an inducement to return, Madame.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She drew a long, shivering sigh, at the thought of his peril, I fancied,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and she sat back against the wall. Nor did she say any more, though I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: heard her sigh again. In a moment she rose.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'The afternoons are growing chilly,' she said; 'I will go in and see how
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Mademoiselle is. Sometimes she does not come to supper. If she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cannot descend this evening, I am afraid that you must excuse me too,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Monsieur.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I said what was right, and watched her go in; and, as I did so, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: loathed my errand, and the mean contemptible curiosity which it had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: planted in my mind, more than at any former time. These women--I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: find it in my heart to hate them for their frankness, for their foolish
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: confidence, and the silly trustfulness that made them so easy a prey!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: NOM DE DIEU! What did the woman mean by telling me all this? To meet
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me in such a way, to disarm one by such methods, was to take an unfair
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: advantage. It put a vile--ay, the vilest--aspect, on the work I had to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: do.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Yet it was very odd! What could M. de Cocheforet mean by returning so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: soon, if M. de Cocheforet was here? And, on the other hand, if it was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not his unexpected presence that had so upset the house, what was the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: secret? Whom had Clon been tracking? And what was the cause of Madame's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: anxiety? In a few minutes I began to grow curious again; and, as the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ladies did not appear at supper, I had leisure to give my brain full
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: licence, and, in the course of an hour, thought of a hundred keys to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mystery. But none exactly fitted the lock, or laid open the secret.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: A false alarm that evening helped to puzzle me still more. I was sitting
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: about an hour after supper, on the same seat in the garden--I had my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cloak and was smoking--when Madame came out like a ghost, and, without
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seeing me, flitted away through the darkness toward the stables. For a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moment I hesitated, and then I followed her. She went down the path and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: round the stables, and, so far, I saw nothing strange in her actions;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: but when she had in this way gained the rear of the west wing, she took
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a track through the thicket to the east of the house again, and so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: came back to the garden. This gained, she came up the path and went in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: through the parlour door, and disappeared--alter making a clear circuit
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the house, and not once pausing or looking to right or left! I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: confess I was fairly baffled. I sank back on the seat I had left, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said to myself that this was the lamest of all conclusions. I was sure
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that she had exchanged no word with anyone. I was equally sure that she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had not detected my presence behind her. Why, then, had she made this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: strange promenade, alone, unprotected, an hour after nightfall? No dog
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had bayed, no one had moved, she had not once paused, or listened, like
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a person expecting a rencontre. I could not make it out. And I came no
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: nearer to solving it, though I lay awake an hour beyond my usual time.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In the morning, neither of the ladies descended to dinner, and I heard
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that Mademoiselle was not so well. After a lonely meal, therefore I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: missed them more than I should have supposed--I retired to my favourite
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seat and fell to meditating.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The day was fine, and the garden pleasant. Sitting there with my eyes on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the old fashioned herb-beds, with the old-fashioned scents in the air,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and the dark belt of trees bounding the view on either side, I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: believe that I had been out of Paris not three weeks, but three months.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The quiet lapped me round. I could fancy that I had never loved anything
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: else. The wood-doves cooed in the stillness; occasionally the harsh cry
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of a jay jarred the silence. It was an hour after noon, and hot. I think
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I nodded.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On a sudden, as if in a dream, I saw Clon's face peering at me round the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: angle of the parlour door. He looked, and in a moment withdrew, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: heard whispering. The door was gently closed. Then all was still again.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I was wide awake now, and thinking. Clearly the people of the house
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wished to assure themselves that I was asleep and safely out of the way.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: As clearly, it was to my interest to be in the way. Giving place to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the temptation, I rose quietly, and, stooping below the level of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: windows, slipped round the east end of the house, passing between it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and the great yew hedge. Here I found all still and no one stirring; so,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: keeping a wary eye about me, I went on round the house--reversing the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: route which Madame had taken the night before--until I gained the rear
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the stables. Here I had scarcely paused a second to scan the ground
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before two persons came out of the stable-court. They were Madame and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the porter.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: They stood a brief while outside and looked up and down. Then Madame
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said something to the man, and he nodded. Leaving him standing where he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was, she crossed the grass with a quick, light step, and vanished among
title: Under the Red Robe

text: the trees.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In a moment my mind was made up to follow; and, as Clon turned at once
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and went in, I was able to do so before it was too late. Bending low
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: among the shrubs, I ran hotfoot to the point where Madame had entered
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the wood. Here I found a narrow path, and ran nimbly along it, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: presently saw her grey robe fluttering among the trees before me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It only remained to keep out of her sight and give her no chance of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: discovering that she was followed; and this I set myself to do. Once
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: or twice she glanced round, but the wood was of beech, the light
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which passed between the leaves was mere twilight, and my clothes were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dark-coloured. I had every advantage, therefore, and little to fear
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as long as I could keep her in view and still remain myself at such a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: distance that the rustle of my tread would not disturb her.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Assured that she was on her way to meet her husband, whom my presence
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: kept from the house, I felt that the crisis had come at last, and I grew
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more excited with each step I took. I detested the task of watching her;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it filled me with peevish disgust. But in proportion as I hated it I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was eager to have it done and be done with it, and succeed, and stuff my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ears and begone from the scene. When she presently came to the verge of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the beech wood, and, entering a little open clearing, seemed to loiter,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I went cautiously. This, I thought, must be the rendezvous; and I held
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: back warily, looking to see him step out of the thicket.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But he did not, and by-and-by she quickened her pace. She crossed the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: open and entered a wide ride cut through a low, dense wood of alder and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dwarf oak--a wood so closely planted and so intertwined with hazel and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: high, on either side of the track.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Down this she passed, and I stood and watched her go, for I dared not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: follow. The ride stretched away as straight as a line for four or five
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hundred yards, a green path between green walls. To enter it was to be
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: immediately detected, if she turned, while the thicket itself permitted
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: no passage. I stood baffled and raging, and watched her pass along. It
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seemed an age before she at last reached the end, and, turning sharply
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the right, was in an instant gone from sight.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I waited then no longer. I started off, and, running as lightly and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: quietly as I could, I sped down the green alley. The sun shone into
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it, the trees kept off the wind, and between heat and haste I sweated
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: finely. But the turf was soft, and the ground fell slightly, and in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: little more than a minute I gained the end. Fifty yards short of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: turning I stopped, and, stealing on, looked cautiously the way she had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gone.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I saw before me a second ride, the twin of the other, and a hundred
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and fifty paces down it her grey figure tripping on between the green
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hedges. I stood and took breath, and cursed the wood and the heat
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and Madame's wariness. We must have come a league, or two-thirds of a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: league, at least. How far did the man expect her to plod to meet him?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I began to grow angry. There is moderation even in the cooking of eggs,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and this wood might stretch into Spain, for all I knew!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Presently she turned the corner and was gone again, and I had to repeat
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my manoeuvre. This time, surely, I should find a change. But no! Another
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: green ride stretched away into the depths of the forest, with hedges of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: varying shades--here light and there dark, as hazel and elder, or thorn,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and yew and box prevailed--but always high and stiff and impervious.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Halfway down the ride Madame's figure tripped steadily on, the only
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moving thing in sight. I wondered, stood, and, when she vanished,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: followed-only to find that she had entered another track, a little
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: narrower but in every other respect alike.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And so it went on for quite half an hour. Sometimes Madame turned to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the right, sometimes to the left. The maze seemed to be endless. Once or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: twice I wondered whether she had lost her way, and was merely seeking to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: return. But her steady, purposeful gait, her measured pace, forbade the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: idea. I noticed, too, that she seldom looked behind her--rarely to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: right or left. Once the ride down which she passed was carpeted not with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: green, but with the silvery, sheeny leaves of some creeping plant that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in the distance had a shimmer like that of water at evening. As she trod
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: this, with her face to the low sun, her tall grey figure had a pure air
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that for the moment startled me--she looked unearthly. Then I swore
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in scorn of myself, and at the next corner I had my reward. She was no
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: longer walking on. She had stopped, I found, and seated herself on a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fallen tree that lay in the ride.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: For some time I stood in ambush watching her, and with each minute I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: grew more impatient. At last I began to doubt--to have strange thoughts.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The green walls were growing dark. The sun was sinking; a sharp, white
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: peak, miles and miles away, which closed the vista of the ride, began
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to flush and colour rosily. Finally, but not before I had had leisure to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: grow uneasy, she stood up and walked on more slowly. I waited, as usual,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: until the next turning hid her. Then I hastened after her, and, warily
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: passing round the corner came face to face with her!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I knew all in a moment saw all in a flash: that she had fooled me,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: tricked me, lured me away. Her face was white with scorn, her eyes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: blazed; her figure, as she confronted me, trembled with anger and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: infinite contempt.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You spy!' she cried. 'You hound! You--gentleman! Oh, MON DIEU! if you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: are one of us--if you are really not of the CANAILLE--we shall pay for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: this some day! We shall pay a heavy reckoning in the time to come! I did
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not think,' she continued, and her every syllable was like the lash of a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whip, 'that there was anything so vile as you in this world!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stammered something--I do not know what. Her words burned into
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me--into my heart! Had she been a man, I would have struck her dead!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You thought that you deceived me yesterday,' she continued, lowering
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her tone, but with no lessening of the passion, the contempt, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: indignation, which curled her lip and gave fullness to her voice. 'You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: plotter! You surface trickster! You thought it an easy task to delude
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a woman--you find yourself deluded. God give you shame that you may
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: suffer!' she continued mercilessly. 'You talked of Clon, but Clon beside
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: you is the most spotless, the most honourable of men!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Madame,' I said hoarsely--and I know that my face was grey as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ashes--'let us understand one another.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'God forbid!' she cried on the instant. 'I would not soil myself!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Fie! Madame,' I said, trembling. But then, you are a woman. That should
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cost a man his life!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She laughed bitterly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You say well,' she retorted. 'I am not a man--and if you are one, thank
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: God for it. Neither am I Madame. Madame de Cocheforet has spent this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: afternoon--thanks to your absence and your imbecility--with her husband.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Yes, I hope that hurts you!' she went on, savagely snapping her little
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: white teeth together. 'I hope that stings you; to spy and do vile work,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and do it ill, Monsieur Mouchard--Monsieur de Mouchard, I should say--I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: congratulate you!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You are not Madame de Cocheforet?' I cried, stunned, even in the midst
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of my shame and rage, by this blow.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No, Monsieur!' she answered grimly. 'I am not! I am not. And permit me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to point out--for we do not all lie easily--that I never said I was. You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: deceived yourself so skilfully that we had no need to trick you.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Mademoiselle, then?' I muttered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Is Madame!' she cried. 'Yes, and I am Mademoiselle de Cocheforet. And
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in that character, and in all others, I beg from this moment to close
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: our acquaintance, sir. When we meet again--if we ever do meet, which God
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forbid!' she went on, her eyes sparkling--'do not presume to speak to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me, or I will have you flogged by the grooms. And do not stain our roof
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by sleeping under it again. You may lie to-night in the inn. It shall
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not be said that Cocheforet,' she continued proudly, 'returned even
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: treachery with inhospitality; and I will give orders to that end. But
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to-morrow begone back to your master, like the whipped cur you are! Spy
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and coward!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: With those last words she moved away. I would have said something, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: could almost have found it in my heart to stop her and make her hear.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Nay, I had dreadful thoughts; for I was the stronger, and I might have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: done with her as I pleased. But she swept by me so fearlessly, as I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might pass some loathsome cripple on the road, that I stood turned to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stone. Without looking at me, without turning her head to see whether
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I followed or remained, or what I did, she went steadily down the track
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: until the trees and the shadow and the growing darkness hid her grey
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: figure from me; and I found myself alone.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: CHAPTER V. REVENGE
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And full of black rage! Had she only reproached me, or, turning on me in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the hour of MY victory, said all that she had now said in the moment
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of her own, I could have borne it. She might have shamed me then, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might have taken the shame to myself and forgiven her. But, as it was,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stood there in the gathering dusk, between the darkening hedges,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: baffled, tricked, defeated! And by a woman! She had pitted her wits
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: against mine, her woman's will against my experience, and she had come
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: off the victor. And then she had reviled me! As I took it all in, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: began to comprehend also the more remote results, and how completely her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: move had made further progress on my part impossible, I hated her. She
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had tricked me with her gracious ways and her slow-coming smile. And,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: after all--for what she had said--it was this man's life or mine. 'What
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had I done that another man would not do? MON DIEU! in the future there
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was nothing I would not do. I would make her smart for those words of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hers! I would bring her to her knees!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Still, hot as I was, an hour might have restored me to coolness. But
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: when I started to return, I fell into a fresh rage, for I remembered
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that I did not know my way out of the maze of rides and paths into which
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she had drawn me; and this and the mishaps which followed, kept my rage
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hot. For a full hour I wandered in the wood, unable, though I knew
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: where the village lay, to find any track which led continuously in one
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: direction. Whenever, at the end of each attempt, the thicket brought me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: up short, I fancied that I heard her laughing on the farther side of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: brake; and the ignominy of this chance punishment, and the check which
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the confinement placed on my rage, almost maddened me. In the darkness I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fell, and rose cursing; I tore my hands with thorns; I stained my suit,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which had suffered sadly once before. At length, when I had almost
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: resigned myself to lie in the wood, I caught sight of the lights of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: village, and, trembling between haste and anger, pressed towards them.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In a few minutes I stood in the little street.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The lights of the inn shone only fifty yards away; but before I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: show myself even there pride suggested that I should do something to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: repair my clothes. I stopped, and scraped and brushed them; and, at the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: same time, did what I could to compose my features. Then I advanced to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the door and knocked. Almost on the instant the landlord's voice cried
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from the inside, 'Enter, Monsieur!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I raised the latch and went in. The man was alone, squatting over the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fire warming his hands. A black pot simmered on the ashes, As I entered
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he raised the lid and peeped inside. Then he glanced over his shoulder.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You expected me?' I said defiantly, walking to the hearth, and setting
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: one of my damp boots on the logs.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes,' he answered, nodding curtly. 'Your supper is just ready. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thought that you would be in about this time.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He grinned as he spoke, and it was with difficulty I suppressed my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wrath.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Mademoiselle de Cocheforet told you,' I said, affecting indifference,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'where I was?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ay, Mademoiselle--or Madame,' he replied, grinning afresh.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: So she had told him; where she had left me, and how she had tricked me!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She had, made me the village laughing-stock! My rage flashed out afresh
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at the thought, and, at the sight of his mocking face, I raised my fist.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But he read the threat in my eyes, and was up in a moment, snarling,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with his hand on his knife.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Not again, Monsieur!' he cried, in his vile patois. 'My head is sore
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: still raise your hand and I will rip you up as I would a pig!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Sit down, fool,' I said. 'I am not going to harm you. Where is your
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wife?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'About her business.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: vegetables into it. Then he went to a cupboard and brought out a loaf of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You see it,' he said laconically.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He flamed into sudden passion at that. Leaning with both his hands on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the table he thrust his rugged face and blood-shot eyes close to mine.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: His moustachios bristled, his beard trembled.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hark ye, sirrah!' he muttered, with sullen emphasis, 'be content! I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have my suspicions. And if it were not for my lady's orders I would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: put a knife into you, fair or foul, this very night. You would lie
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: countenance. 'Threatened men live long, you rascal!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'In Paris!' he answered significantly. 'Not here, Monsieur.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He straightened himself with that, nodded once, and went back to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fire; and I shrugged my shoulders and began to eat, affecting to forget
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: to discover the darkness. The room, with its low roof and earthen floor,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and foul clothes flung here and there, reeked of stale meals and garlic
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and vile cooking. I thought of the parlour at Cocheforet, and the dainty
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: table, and the stillness, and the scented pot-herbs; and though I was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: too old a soldier to eat the worse because my spoon lacked washing, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: felt the change, and laid it savagely at Mademoiselle's door.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The landlord, watching me stealthily from his place by the hearth, read
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my thoughts and chuckled aloud.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Palace fare, palace manners!' he muttered scornfully. 'Set a beggar on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horseback, and he will ride--back to the inn!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Keep a civil tongue, will you!' I answered, scowling at him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Have you finished?' he retorted.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I rose, without deigning to reply, and, going to the fire, drew off my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: boots, which were wet through. He, on the instant, swept off the wine
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and loaf to the cupboard, and then, coming back for the platter I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: used, took it, opened the back door, and went out, leaving the door
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ajar. The draught which came in beat the flame of the lamp this way and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that, and gave the dingy, gloomy room an air still more miserable. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: rose angrily from the fire, and went to the door, intending to close it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with a bang.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But when I reached it, I saw something, between door and jamb, which
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stayed my hand. The door led to a shed in which the housewife washed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pots and the like. I felt some surprise, therefore, when I found a light
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: there at this time of night; still more surprise when I saw what she was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: doing.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She was seated on the mud floor, with a rush-light before her, and on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: either side of her a high-piled heap of refuse and rubbish. From one
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of these, at the moment I caught sight of her, she was sorting
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: things--horrible filthy sweepings of road or floor--to the other;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shaking and sifting each article as she passed it across, and then
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: taking up another and repeating the action with it, and so on--all
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: minutely, warily, with an air of so much patience and persistence that I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood wondering. Some things--rags--she held up between her eyes and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the light, some she passed through her fingers, some she fairly tore
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in pieces. And all the time her husband stood watching her greedily, my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: platter still in his hand, as if her strange occupation fascinated him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stood looking, also, for half a minute, perhaps; then the man's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eye, raised for a single second to the door-way, met mine. He started,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: muttered something to his wife, and, quick as thought, he kicked
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the light out, leaving the shed in darkness. Cursing him for an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ill-conditioned fellow, I walked back to the fire, laughing. In a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: twinkling he followed me, his face dark with rage. 'VENTRE-SAINT-GRIS!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he exclaimed, thrusting himself close to me. 'Is not a man's house his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: own?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is, for me,' I answered coolly, shrugging my shoulders. 'And
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his wife: if she likes to pick dirty rags at this hour, that is your
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: affair.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Pig of a spy!' he cried, foaming with rage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was angry enough at bottom, but I had nothing to gain by quarrelling
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with the fellow; and I curtly bade him remember himself.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Your mistress gave you orders,' I said contemptuously. 'Obey them.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He spat on the floor, but at the same time he grew calmer.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You are right there,' he answered spitefully. 'What matter, after all,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: since you leave to-morrow at six? Your horse has been sent down, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: your baggage is above.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I will go to it,' I retorted. 'I want none of your company. Give me a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: light, fellow!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He obeyed reluctantly, and, glad to turn my back on him, I went up the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ladder, still wondering faintly, in the midst of my annoyance, what his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wife was about that my chance detection of her had so enraged him. Even
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: now he was not quite himself. He followed me with abuse, and, deprived
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by my departure of any other means of showing his spite, fell to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shouting through the floor, bidding me remember six o'clock, and be
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stirring; with other taunts, which did not cease until he had tired
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: himself out.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The sight of my belongings--which I had left a few hours before at the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Chateau--strewn about the floor of this garret, went some way towards
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: firing me again. But I was worn out. The indignities and mishaps of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: evening had, for once, crushed my spirit, and after swearing an oath or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: two I began to pack my bags. Vengeance I would have; but the time and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: manner I left for daylight thought. Beyond six o'clock in the morning I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: did not look forward; and if I longed for anything it was for a little
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the good Armagnac I had wasted on those louts of merchants in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: kitchen below. It might have done me good now.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had wearily strapped up one bag, and nearly filled the other, when I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: came upon something which did, for the moment, rouse the devil in me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: This was the tiny orange-coloured sachet which Mademoiselle had dropped
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the night I first saw her at the inn, and which, it will be remembered,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I picked up. Since that night I had not seen it, and had as good as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forgotten it. Now, as I folded up my other doublet, the one I had then
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: been wearing, it dropped from my pocket.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The sight of it recalled all--that night, and Mademoiselle's face in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lantern light, and my fine plans, and the end of them; and, in a fit of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: childish fury, the outcome of long suppressed passion, I snatched up
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the sachet from the floor and tore it across and across, and flung the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pieces down. As they fell, a cloud of fine pungent dust burst from them,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and with the dust, something more solid, which tinkled sharply on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the boards, as it fell. I looked down to see what this was--perhaps I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: already repented of my act; but for a moment I could see nothing. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: floor was grimy and uninviting, the light bad.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In certain moods, however, a man is obstinate about small things, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moved the taper nearer. As I did so a point of light, a flashing sparkle
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that shone for a second among the dirt and refuse on the floor, caught
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my eye. It was gone in a moment, but I had seen it. I stared, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moved the light again, and the spark flashed out afresh, this time in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a different place. Much puzzled, I knelt, and, in a twinkling, found a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: tiny crystal. Hard by it lay another--and another; each as large as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a fair-sized pea. I took up the three, and rose to my feet again, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: light in one hand, the crystals in the palm of the other.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: They were diamonds! Diamonds of price! I knew it in a moment. As I moved
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the taper to and fro above them, and watched the fire glow and tremble
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in their depths, I knew that I held in my hand that which would buy the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crazy inn and all its contents a dozen times over! They were diamonds!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Gems so fine, and of so rare a water--or I had never seen gems--that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my hand trembled as I held them, and my head grew hot and my heart beat
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: furiously. For a moment I thought that I dreamed, that my fancy played
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me some trick; and I closed my eyes and did not open them again for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a minute. But when I did, there they were, hard, real, and angular.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Convinced at last, in a maze of joy and fear, I closed my hand upon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: them, and, stealing on tip-toe to the trap-door, laid first my saddle on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it and then my bags, and over all my cloak, breathing fast the while.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Then I stole back, and, taking up the light again, began to search the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: floor, patiently, inch by inch, with naked feet, every sound making
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me tremble as I crept hither and thither over the creaking boards. And
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: never was search more successful or better paid. In the fragments of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sachet I found six smaller diamonds and a pair of rubies. Eight large
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: diamonds I found on the floor. One, the largest and last found, had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bounded away, and lay against the wall in the farthest corner. It took
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me an hour to run that one to earth; but afterwards I spent another hour
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: on my hands and knees before I gave up the search, and, satisfied at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: last that I had collected all, sat down on my saddle on the trap-door,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and, by the last flickering light of a candle which I had taken from my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bag, gloated over my treasure--a treasure worthy of fabled Golconda.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Hardly could I believe in its reality, even now. Recalling the jewels
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which the English Duke of Buckingham wore on the occasion of his visit
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to Paris in 1625, and whereof there was so much talk, I took these to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be as fine, though less in number. They should be worth fifteen thousand
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crowns, more or less. Fifteen thousand crowns! And I held them in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hollow of my hand--I, who was scarcely worth ten thousand sous.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The candle going out cut short my admiration. Left in the dark with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: these precious atoms, my first thought was how I might dispose of them
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: safely; which I did, for the time, by secreting them in the lining of my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: boot. My second thought turned on the question how they had come where I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had found them, among the powdered spice and perfumes in Mademoiselle de
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cocheforet's sachet.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: A minute's reflection enabled me to come very near the secret, and at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the same time shed a flood of light on several dark places, What Clon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had been seeking on the path between the house and the village, what the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: goodwife of the inn had sought among the sweepings of yard and floor,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I knew now the sachet--knew, too, what had caused the marked and sudden
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: anxiety I had noticed at the Chateau--the loss of this sachet.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And there for a while I came to a check But one step more up the ladder
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of thought brought all in view. In a flash I guessed how the jewels had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: come to be in the sachet; and that it was not Mademoiselle but M.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: de Cocheforet who had mislaid them. I thought this last discovery
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so important that I began to pace the room softly, unable, in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: excitement, to remain still.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Doubtless he had dropped the jewels in the hurry of his start from the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: inn that night! Doubtless, too, he had carried them in that bizarre
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hiding-place for the sake of safety, considering it unlikely that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: robbers, if he fell into their hands, would take the sachet from him;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as still less likely that they would suspect it to contain anything
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of value. Everywhere it would pass for a love-gift, the work of his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mistress.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Nor did my penetration stop there. I guessed that the gems were family
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: property, the last treasure of the house; and that M. de Cocheforet,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: when I saw him at the inn, was on his way to convey them out of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: country; either to secure them from seizure by the Government, or to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: raise money by selling them--money to be spent in some last desperate
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: enterprise. For a day or two, perhaps, after leaving Cocheforet, while
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the mountain road and its chances occupied his thoughts, he had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: discovered his loss. Then he had searched for the precious sachet,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: missed it, and returned hot-foot on his tracks.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The longer I considered the circumstances the more certain I was that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had hit on the true solution; and all that night I sat wakeful in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: darkness, pondering what I should do. The stones, unset as they were,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: could never be identified, never be claimed. The channel by which they
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had come to my hands could never be traced. To all intents they were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mine; mine, to do with as I pleased! Fifteen thousand crowns, perhaps
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: twenty thousand crowns, and I to leave at six in the morning, whether I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would or no! I might leave for Spain with the jewels in my pocket. Why
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I confess I was tempted. And indeed the gems were so fine that I doubt
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not some indifferently honest men would have sold salvation for them.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But--a Berault his honour? No. I was tempted, I say; but not for long.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Thank God, a man may be reduced to living by the fortunes of the dice,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and may even be called by a woman 'spy' and 'coward,' without becoming a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thief! The temptation soon left me--I take credit for it--and I fell to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thinking of this and that plan for making use of them. Once it occurred
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to me to take the jewels to the Cardinal and buy my pardon with them;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: again, to use them as a trap to capture Cocheforet; again, to--and then,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: about five in the morning, as I sat up on my wretched pallet, while the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: first light stole slowly in through the cobwebbed, hay-stuffed lattice,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: there came to me the real plan, the plan of plans, on which I acted.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It charmed me I smacked my lips over it, and hugged myself, and felt my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eyes dilate in the darkness, as I conned it. It seemed cruel, it seemed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mean; I cared nothing. Mademoiselle had boasted of her victory over me,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of her woman's wits and her acuteness and of my dullness. She had said
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that her grooms should flog me. She had rated me as if I had been a dog.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Very well; we would see now whose brains were the better, whose was the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: master mind, whose should be the whipping.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The one thing required by my plan was that I should get speech with her;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that done, I could trust myself and my new-found weapon for the rest.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But that was absolutely necessary, and, seeing that there might be some
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: difficulty about it, I determined to descend as if my mind were made
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: up to go; then, on pretence of saddling my horse, I would slip away on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: foot, and lie in wait near the Chateau until I saw her come out. Or if
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I could not effect my purpose in that way--either by reason of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: landlord's vigilance, or for any other cause--my course was still easy.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I would ride away, and when I had proceeded a mile or so, tie up my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse in the forest and return to the wooden bridge. Thence I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: watch the garden and front of the Chateau until time and chance gave me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the opportunity I sought.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: So I saw my way quite clearly; and when the fellow below called me,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: reminding me rudely that I must be going, and that it was six o'clock,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was ready with my answer. I shouted sulkily that I was coming, and,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: after a decent delay, I took up my saddle and bags and went down.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Viewed by the light of a cold morning, the inn-room looked more smoky,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more grimy, more wretched than when I had last seen it. The goodwife was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not visible. The fire was not lighted. No provision, not so much as a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stirrup-cup or bowl of porridge cheered the heart.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I looked round, sniffing the stale smell of last night's lamp, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: grunted.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Are you going to send me out fasting?' I said, affecting a worse humour
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: than I felt.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The landlord was standing by the window, stooping over a great pair of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: frayed and furrowed thigh-boots which he was labouring to soften with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: copious grease.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Mademoiselle ordered no breakfast,' he answered, with a malicious grin.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well it does not much matter,' I replied grandly. 'I shall be at Auch
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by noon.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is as may be,' he answered with another grin.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I did not understand him, but I had something else to think about, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: opened the door and stepped out, intending to go to the stable. Then in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a second I comprehended. The cold air laden with woodland moisture
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: met me and went to my bones; but it was not that which made me shiver.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Outside the door, in the road, sitting on horseback in silence, were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: two men. One was Clon. The other, who had a spare horse by the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John
