text: rein--my horse--was a man I had seen at the inn, a rough, shock-headed,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hard-bitten fellow. Both were armed, and Clon was booted. His mate rode
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: barefoot, with a rusty spur strapped to one heel.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The moment I saw them a sure and certain fear crept into my mind: it was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that which made me shiver. But I did not speak to them. I went in again
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and closed the door behind me. The landlord was putting on his boots.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What does this mean?' I said hoarsely--though I had a clear prescience
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of what was coming. 'Why are these men here?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Orders,' he answered laconically.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Whose orders?' I retorted.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Whose?' he answered bluntly. 'Well, Monsieur, that is my business.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Enough that we mean to see you out of the country, and out of harm's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: way.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But if I will not go?' I cried.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Monsieur will go,' he answered coolly. 'There are no strangers in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: village to-day,' he added, with a significant smile.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Do you mean to kidnap me?' I replied, in a rage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But behind the rage was something else--I will not call it terror, for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the brave feel no terror but it was near akin to it. I had had to do
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with rough men all my life, but there was a grimness and truculence
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in the aspect of these three that shook me. When I thought of the dark
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: paths and narrow lanes and cliff sides we must traverse, whichever road
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: we took, I trembled.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Kidnap you, Monsieur?' he answered, with an every-day air. 'That is
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as you please to call it. One thing is certain, however,' he continued,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: maliciously touching an arquebuss which he had brought out, and set
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: upright against a chair while I was at the door; if you attempt the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: slightest resistance, we shall know how to put an end to it, either here
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: or on the road.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I drew a deep breath, the very imminence of the danger restoring me to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the use of my faculties. I changed my tone and laughed aloud.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'So that is your plan, is it?' I said. 'The sooner we start the better,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: then. And the sooner I see Auch and your back turned, the more I shall
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be pleased.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He rose. 'After you, Monsieur,' he said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I could not restrain a slight shiver. His new-born politeness alarmed me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more than his threats. I knew the man and his ways, and I was sure that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it boded ill to me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I had no pistols, and only my sword and knife, and I knew that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: resistance at this point must be worse than vain. I went out jauntily,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: therefore, the landlord coming after me with my saddle and bags.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The street was empty, save for the two waiting horsemen who sat in their
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: saddles looking doggedly before them, The sun had not yet risen, the air
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was raw. The sky was grey, cloudy, and cold. My thoughts flew back to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the morning on which I had found the sachet--at that very spot, almost
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at that very hour, and for a moment I grew warm again at the thought of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the little packet I carried in my boot. But the landlord's dry manner,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the sullen silence of his two companions, whose eyes steadily refused
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to meet mine, chilled me again. For an instant the impulse to refuse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to mount, to refuse to go, was almost irresistible; then, knowing the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: madness of such a course, which might, and probably would, give the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: men the chance they desired, I crushed it down and went slowly to my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stirrup.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I wonder you do not want my sword,' I said by way of sarcasm, as I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swung myself up.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'We are not afraid of it,' the innkeeper answered gravely. 'You may keep
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it--for the present.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I made no answer--what answer had I to make?--and we rode at a footpace
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: down the street; he and I leading, Clon and the shock-headed man
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bringing up the rear. The leisurely mode of our departure, the absence
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of hurry or even haste, the men's indifference whether they were seen,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: or what was thought, all served to sink my spirits and deepen my sense
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of peril. I felt that they suspected me, that they more than half
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: guessed the nature of my errand at Cocheforet, and that they were not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: minded to be bound by Mademoiselle's orders. In particular, I augured
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the worst from Clon's appearance. His lean malevolent face and sunken
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eyes, his very dumbness chilled me. Mercy had no place there.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We rode soberly, so that nearly half an hour elapsed before we gained
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the brow from which I had taken my first look at Cocheforet. Among
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the dwarf oaks whence I had viewed the valley we paused to breathe our
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horses, and the strange feelings with which I looked back on the scene
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: may be imagined. But I had short time for indulging in sentiment or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: recollections. A curt word, and we were moving again.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: A quarter of a mile farther on, the road to Auch dipped into the valley.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: When we were already half way down this descent the innkeeper suddenly
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stretched out his hand and caught my rein.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'This way!' he said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I saw that he would have me turn into a by-path leading
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: south-westwards--a mere track, faint and little trodden and encroached
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: on by trees, which led I knew not whither. I checked my horse.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Why?' I said rebelliously. 'Do you think I do not know the road? The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: road we are in is the way to Auch.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'To Auch--yes,' he answered bluntly. 'But we are not going to Auch,'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Whither then?' I said angrily.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You will see presently,' he replied with an ugly smile.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes, but I will know now!' I retorted, passion getting the better of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me. 'I have come so far with you. You will find it more easy to take me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: farther if you tell me your plans.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You are a fool!' he cried with a snarl.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Not so,' I answered. 'I ask only to know whither I am going.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Into Spain,' he said. 'Will that satisfy you?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And what will you do with me there?' I asked, my heart giving a great
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bound.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hand you over to some friends of ours,' he answered curtly, 'if you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: behave yourself. If not, there is a shorter way, and one that will save
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: us some travelling. Make up your mind, Monsieur. Which shall it be?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: CHAPTER VI. So that was their plan. Two or three hours to the southward,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the long, white, glittering wall stretched east and west above the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: brown woods. Beyond that lay Spain. Once across the border, I might be
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: detained, if no worse happened to me, as a prisoner of war; for we were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: then at war with Spain on the Italian side. Or I might be handed over
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to one of the savage bands, half smugglers, half brigands, that held the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: passes; or be delivered, worse fate of all, into the power of the French
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: exiles, of whom some would be likely to recognise me and cut my throat.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is a long way into Spain,' I muttered, watching in a kind of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fascination Clon handling his pistols.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I think you will find the other road longer still,' the landlord
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answered grimly. 'But choose, and be quick about it.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: They were three to one, and they had firearms. In effect I had no
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: choice.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well, if I must I must?' I cried, making up my mind with seeming
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: recklessness. 'VOGUE LA GALERE! Spain be it. It will not be the first
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: time I have heard the dons talk.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The men nodded, as much as to say that they had known what the end would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be; the landlord released my rein; and in a trice we were riding down
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the narrow track, with our faces set towards the mountains.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On one point my mind was now more easy. The men meant fairly by me, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had no longer to fear, as I had feared, a pistol-shot in the back at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the first convenient ravine. As far as that went, I might ride in peace.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On the other hand, if I let them carry me across the border my fate
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was sealed. A man set down without credentials or guards among the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wild desperadoes who swarmed in war-time in the Asturian passes might
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: consider himself fortunate if an easy death fell to his lot. In my case
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I could make a shrewd guess what would happen. A single nod of meaning,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: one muttered word, dropped among the savage men with whom I should
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be left, and the diamonds hidden in my boot would go neither to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cardinal nor back to Mademoiselle--nor would it matter to me whither
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: they went.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: So while the others talked in their taciturn fashion, or sometimes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: grinned at my gloomy face, I looked out over the brown woods with eyes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that saw yet did not see. The red squirrel swarming up the trunk, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: startled pigs that rushed away grunting from their feast of mast, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: solitary rider who met us, armed to the teeth, and passed northwards
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: after whispering with the landlord--all these I saw. But my mind was not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with them. It was groping and feeling about like a hunted mole for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: some way of escape. For time pressed. The slope we were on was growing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: steeper. By-and-by we fell into a southward valley, and began to follow
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it steadily upwards, crossing and recrossing a swiftly rushing stream.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The snow peaks began to be hidden behind the rising bulk of hills that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: overhung us, and sometimes we could see nothing before or behind but the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wooded walls of our valley rising sheer and green a thousand paces high
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: on either hand; with grey rocks half masked by fern and ivy jutting here
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and there through the firs and alders.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was a wild and sombre scene even at that hour, with the mid-day sun
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shining on the rushing water and drawing the scent out of the pines;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: but I knew that there was worse to come, and sought desperately for some
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ruse by which I might at least separate the men. Three were too many;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with one I might deal. At last, when I had cudgelled my brain for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: an hour, and almost resigned myself to a sudden charge on the men
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: single-handed--a last desperate resort--I thought of a plan: dangerous,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: too, and almost desperate, but which still seemed to promise something.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It came of my fingers resting, as they lay in my pocket, on the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fragments of the orange sachet; which, without having any particular
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: design in my mind, I had taken care to bring with me. I had torn the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sachet into four pieces--four corners. As I played mechanically with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: them, one of my fingers fitted into one, as into a glove; a second
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: finger into another. And the plan came.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Before I could move in it, however, I had to wait until we stopped to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bait the flagging horses, which we did about noon at the head of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: valley. Then, pretending to drink from the stream, I managed to secure
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unseen a handful of pebbles, slipping them into the same pocket with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the morsels of stuff. On getting to horse again, I carefully fitted a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pebble, not too tightly, into the largest scrap, and made ready for the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: attempt.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The landlord rode on my left, abreast of me; the other two knaves
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: behind. The road at this stage favoured me, for the valley, which
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: drained the bare uplands that lay between the lower hills and the base
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the real mountains, had become wide and shallow. Here were no trees,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and the path was a mere sheep-track covered with short, crisp grass, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: running sometimes on this bank of the stream and sometimes on that.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I waited until the ruffian beside me turned to speak to the men behind.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The moment he did so, and his eyes were averted, I slipped out the scrap
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of satin in which I had placed the pebble, and balancing it carefully on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my right thigh as I rode, I flipped it forward with all the strength
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of my thumb and finger. I meant it to fall a few paces before us in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: path, where it could be seen. But alas for my hopes! At the critical
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moment my horse started, my finger struck the scrap aslant, the pebble
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: flew out, and the bit of stuff fluttered into a whin-bush close to my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stirrup--and was lost!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was bitterly disappointed, for the same thing might happen again, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had now only three scraps left. But fortune favoured me, by putting
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it into my neighbour's head to plunge into a hot debate with the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shock-headed man on the nature of some animals seen on a distant brow;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which he said were izards, while the other maintained that they were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: common goats. He continued, on this account, to ride with his face
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: turned from me, and I had time to fit another pebble into the second
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: piece of stuff. Sliding it on to my thigh, I poised it, and flipped it.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: This time my finger struck the tiny missile fairly in the middle, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shot it so far and so truly that it dropped exactly in the path ten
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: paces in front of us. The moment I saw it fall I kicked my neighbour's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: nag in the ribs; it started, and he, turning in a rage, hit it. The next
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: instant he pulled it almost on to its haunches.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'SAINT GRIS!' he cried; and sat glaring at the bit of yellow satin, with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his face turned purple and his jaw fallen.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What is it!' I said, staring at him in turn, 'What is the matter,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fool?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Matter?' he blurted out. 'MON DIEU!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But Clon's excitement surpassed even his. The dumb man no sooner
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: saw what had attracted his comrade's attention, than he uttered an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: inarticulate and horrible noise, and tumbling off his horse, more like a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: beast than a man threw himself bodily on the precious morsel.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The innkeeper was not far behind him. An instant and he was down, too,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: peering at the thing; and for an instant I thought that they would fight
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: over it. However, though their jealousy was evident, their excitement
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cooled a little when they discovered that the scrap of stuff was empty;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for, fortunately, the pebble had fallen out of it. Still, it threw them
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: into such a fever of eagerness as it was wonderful to witness. They
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: nosed the ground where it had lain, they plucked up the grass and turf,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and passed it through their fingers, they ran to and fro like dogs on a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: trail; and, glancing askance at one another, came back always together
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the point of departure. Neither in his jealousy would suffer the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: other to be there alone.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The shock-headed man and I sat our horses and looked on; he marvelling,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I pretending to marvel. As the two searched up and down the path,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: we moved a little out of it to give them space; and presently, when
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all their heads were turned from me, I let a second morsel drop under a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gorse-bush. The shock-headed man, by-and-by, found this, and gave it to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Clon; and as from the circumstances of the first discovery no suspicion
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: attached to me, I ventured to find the third and last scrap myself. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: did not pick it up, but I called the innkeeper, and he pounced upon it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as I have seen a hawk pounce on a chicken.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: They hunted for the fourth morsel, but, of course, in vain, and in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: end they desisted, and fitted the three they had together; but neither
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would let his own portion out of his hands, and each looked at the other
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: across the spoil with eyes of suspicion. It was strange to see them in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that wide-stretching valley, whence grey boar-backs of hills swelled
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: up into the silence of the snow--it was strange, I say, in that vast
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: solitude, to see these two, mere dots on its bosom, circling round
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: one another in fierce forgetfulness of the outside world, glaring
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and shifting their ground like cocks about to engage, and wholly
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: engrossed--by three scraps of orange-colour, invisible at fifty paces!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: At last the innkeeper cried with an oath, 'I am going back. This must
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be known down yonder. Give me your pieces, man, and do you go on with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Antoine. It will be all right.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But Clon, waving a scrap of the stuff in either hand, and thrusting his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ghastly mask into the other's face, shook his head in passionate denial.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He could not speak, but he made it as clear as daylight that if anyone
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: went back with the news, he was the man to go.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Nonsense!' the landlord rejoined fiercely, 'We cannot leave Antoine to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: go on alone with him. Give me the stuff.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But Clon would not. He had no thought of resigning the credit of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: discovery; and I began to think that the two would really come to blows.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But there was an alternative--an alternative in which I was concerned;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and first one and then the other looked at me. It was a moment of peril,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I knew it. My stratagem might react on myself, and the two, to put
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: an end to their difficulty, agree to put an end to me. But I faced them
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so coolly, and showed so bold a front, and the ground where we stood was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so open, that the idea took no root. They fell to wrangling again more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: viciously than before. One tapped his gun and the other his pistols. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: landlord scolded, the dumb man gurgled. At last their difference ended
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as I had hoped it would.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Very well then, we will both go back!' the innkeeper cried in a rage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And Antoine must see him on. But the blame be on your head. Do you give
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the lad your pistols.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Clon took one pistol, and gave it to the shock-headed man.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'The other!' the innkeeper said impatiently.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But Clon shook his head with a grim smile, and pointed to the arquebuss.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: By a sudden movement, the landlord snatched the pistol, and averted
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Clon's vengeance by placing both it and the gun in the shock-headed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: man's hands.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'There!' he said, addressing the latter, 'now can you do? If Monsieur
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: tries to escape or turn back, shoot him! But four hours' riding should
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bring you to the Roca Blanca. You will find the men there, and will have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: no more to do with it.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Antoine did not see things quite in that light, however. He looked at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me, and then at the wild track in front of us; and he muttered an oath
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and said he would die if he would.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But the landlord, who was in a frenzy of impatience, drew him aside
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and talked to him, and in the end seemed to persuade him; for in a few
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: minutes the matter was settled.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Antoine came back, and said sullenly, 'Forward, Monsieur,' the two
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: others stood on one side, I shrugged my shoulders and kicked up my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse, and in a twinkling we two were riding on together--man to man.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I turned once or twice to see what those we had left behind were doing,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and always found them standing in apparent debate; but my guard showed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so much jealousy of these movements that I presently shrugged my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shoulders again and desisted.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had racked my brains to bring about this state of things. Strange to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: say, now I had succeeded, I found it less satisfactory than I had hoped.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had reduced the odds and got rid of my most dangerous antagonists; but
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Antoine, left to himself, proved to be as full of suspicion as an egg of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: meat. He rode a little behind me, with his gun across his saddlebow, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a pistol near his hand; and at the slightest pause on my part, or if I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: turned to look at him, he muttered his constant 'Forward, Monsieur!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in a tone which warned me that his finger was on the trigger. At such a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: distance he could not miss; and I saw nothing for it but to go on meekly
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before him to the Roca Blanca--and my fate.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: What was to be done? The road presently reached the end of the valley
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and entered a narrow pine-clad defile, strewn with rocks and boulders,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: over which the torrent plunged and eddied with a deafening roar. In
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: front the white gleam of waterfalls broke the sombre ranks of climbing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: trunks. The snow line lay less than half a mile away on either hand; and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crowning all--at the end of the pass, as it seemed to the eye--rose the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pure white pillar of the Pic du Midi shooting up six thousand feet into
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the blue of heaven. Such a scene so suddenly disclosed, was enough to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: drive the sense of danger from my mind; and for a moment I reined in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse. But 'Forward, Monsieur!' came the grating order. I fell to earth
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: again, and went on. What was to be done?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was at my wits' end to know. The man refused to talk, refused to ride
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: abreast of me, would have no dismounting, no halting, no communication
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at all. He would have nothing but this silent, lonely procession of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: two, with the muzzle of his gun at my back. And meanwhile we were fast
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: climbing the pass. We had left the others an hour--nearly two. The sun
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was declining; the time, I supposed, about half-past three.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: If he would only let me come within reach of him! Or if anything would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fall out to take his attention! When the pass presently widened into a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bare and dreary valley, strewn with huge boulders and with snow lying
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: here and there in the hollows, I looked desperately before me, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: scanned even the vast snow-fields that overhung us and stretched away
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the base of the ice-peak. But I saw nothing. No bear swung across the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: path, no izard showed itself on the cliffs. The keen, sharp air cut our
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cheeks and warned me that we were approaching the summit of the ridge.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On all sides were silence and desolation.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: MON DIEU! And the ruffians on whose tender mercies I was to be thrown
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might come to meet us! They might appear at any moment. In my despair
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I loosened my hat on my head, and let the first gust carry it to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ground, and then with an oath of annoyance tossed my feet from the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stirrups to go after it. But the rascal roared to me to keep my seat.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Forward, Monsieur!' he shouted brutally. 'Go on!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But my hat!' I cried. 'MILLE TONNERRES, man! I must--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Forward, Monsieur, or I shoot!' he replied inexorably raising his gun.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'One--two--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And I went on. But, ah, I was wrathful! That I, Gil de Berault, should
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be outwitted, and led by the nose like a ringed bull, by this Gascon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lout! That I, whom all Paris knew and feared--if it did not love--the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: terror of Zaton's, should come to my end in this dismal waste of snow
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and rock, done to death by some pitiful smuggler or thief! It must not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be. Surely in the last resort I could give an account of one man, though
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his belt were stuffed with pistols.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But how? Only, it seemed, by open force. My heart began to flutter as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I planned it; and then grew steady again. A hundred paces before us a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gully or ravine on the left ran up into the snow-field. Opposite its
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mouth a jumble of stones and broken rocks covered the path, I marked
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: this for the place. The knave would need both his hands to hold up his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: nag over the stones, and, if I turned on him suddenly enough, he might
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: either drop his gun or fire it harmlessly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But, in the meantime, something happened; as, at the last moment, things
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: do happen. While we were still fifty yards short of the place, I found
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his horse's nose creeping forward on a level with my crupper; and, still
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: advancing, still advancing, until I could see it out of the tail of my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eye, and my heart gave a great bound. He was coming abreast of me: he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was going to deliver himself into my hands! To cover my excitement, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: began to whistle.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hush!' he muttered fiercely, his voice sounding so strange and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unnatural, that my first thought was that he was ill; and I turned to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him. But he only said again,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hush! Pass by here quietly, Monsieur.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Why?' I asked mutinously, curiosity getting the better of me. For had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I been wise I had taken no notice; every second his horse was coming up
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with mine. Its nose was level with my stirrup already.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hush, man!' he said again. This time there was no mistake about the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: panic in his voice. 'They call this the Devil's Chapel, God send us safe
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by it! It is late to be here. Look at those!' he continued, pointing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with a finger which visibly shook.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I looked. At the mouth of the gully, in a small space partly cleared of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stones, stood three broken shafts, raised on rude pedestals.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well?' I said in a low voice. The sun, which was near setting, flushed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the great peak above to the colour of blood; but the valley was growing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: grey and each moment more dreary. 'Well, what of those?' I said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In spite of my peril and the excitement of the coming struggle I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: felt the chill of his fear. Never had I seen so grim, so desolate, so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: God-forsaken a place! Involuntarily I shivered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'They were crosses,' he muttered in a voice little above a whisper,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while his eyes roved this way and that in terror. 'The Cure of Gabas
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: blessed the place, and set them up. But next morning they were as you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: see them now. Come on, Monsieur; come on!' he continued, plucking at my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: arm. 'It is not safe here after sunset. Pray God, Satan be not at home!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He had completely forgotten in his panic that he had anything to fear
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from me. His gun dropped loosely across his saddle, his leg rubbed mine.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I saw this, and I changed my plan of action. As our horses reached the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stones I stooped, as if to encourage mine, and, with a sudden clutch,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: snatched the gun bodily from his hand, at the same time that I backed my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse with all my strength. It was done in a moment! A second and I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him at the end of the gun, and my finger was on the trigger. Never was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: victory more easily gained.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He looked at me between rage and terror, his jaw fallen.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Are you mad?' he cried, his teeth chattering as he spoke. Even in this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: strait his eyes left me and wandered round in alarm.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No, sane!' I retorted fiercely. 'But I do not like this place any
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: better than you do.' Which was true enough, if not quite true. 'So, by
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: your right, quick march!' I continued imperatively. 'Turn your horse, my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: friend, or take the consequences.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He turned like a lamb, and headed down the valley again, without giving
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a thought to his pistols. I kept close to him, and in less than a minute
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: we had left the Devil's Chapel well behind us, and were moving down
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: again as we had come up. Only now I held the gun.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: When we had gone have a mile or so--until then I did not feel
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: comfortable myself, and though I thanked heaven that the place existed,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I thanked heaven also that I was out of it--I bade him halt.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Take off your belt,' I said curtly, 'and throw it down. But, mark me,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: if you turn I fire.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The spirit was quite gone out of him, and he obeyed mechanically. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: jumped down, still covering him with the gun, and picked up the belt,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pistols and all. Then I remounted, and we went on. By-and-by he asked me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sullenly what I was going to do.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Go back,' I said, 'and take the road to Auch when I come to it.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It will be dark in an hour,' he answered sulkily.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I know that,' I retorted. 'We must camp and do the best we can.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And as I said, we did. The daylight held until we gained the skirts of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the pine-wood at the head of the pass. Here I chose a corner a little
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: off the track, and well sheltered from the wind, and bade him light a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fire. I tethered the horses near this and within sight. Then it remained
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: only to sup. I had a piece of bread: he had another and an onion. We ate
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in silence, sitting on opposite sides of the fire.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But after supper I found myself in a dilemma; I did not see how I was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to sleep. The ruddy light which gleamed on the knave's swart face and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sinewy hands showed also his eyes, black, sullen, and watchful. I knew
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that the man was plotting revenge; that he would not hesitate to plant
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his knife between my ribs should I give him the chance; and I could find
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: only one alternative to remaining awake. Had I been bloody-minded, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: should have chosen it and solved the question at once and in my favour
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by shooting him as he sat.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I have never been a cruel man, and I could not find it in my heart
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to do this. The silence of the mountain and the sky-which seemed a thing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: apart from the roar of the torrent and not to be broken by it--awed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me. The vastness of the solitude in which we sat, the dark void above,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: through which the stars kept shooting, the black gulf below in which the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unseen waters boiled and surged, the absence of other human company or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: other signs of human existence, put such a face upon the deed that I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gave up the thought of it with a shudder, and resigned myself, instead,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to watch through the night--the long, cold, Pyrenean night. Presently
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he curled himself up like a dog and slept in the blaze, and then for a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: couple of hours I sat opposite him, thinking. It seemed years since

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: the oak groves, and the air was full of warmth as we began to climb the
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mast, and grunted lazily; and high above us a boy lay watching them. 'We
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: part here,' I said to my companion.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was my plan to ride a little way along the road to Auch so as to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: blind his eyes; then, leaving my horse in the forest, I would go on foot
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the Chateau. 'The sooner the better!' he answered with a snarl. 'And
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I hope I may never see your face again, Monsieur.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But when we came to the wooden cross at the fork of the roads, and were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: about to part, the boy we had seen leapt out of the fern and came to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: meet us.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hollo!' he cried in a sing-song tone.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well,' my companion answered, drawing rein impatiently. 'What is it?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'There are soldiers in the village.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Soldiers,' Antoine cried incredulously.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ay, devils on horseback,' the lad answered, spitting on the ground.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Three score of them. From Auch.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Antoine turned to me, his face transformed with fury.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Curse you!' he cried. 'This is some of your work. Now we are all
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: undone. And my mistresses? SACRE! if I had that gun I would shoot you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: like a rat.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Steady, fool,' I answered roughly. 'I know no more of this than you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: do.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Which was so true that my surprise was at least as great as his, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: better grounded. The Cardinal, who rarely made a change of front, had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sent me hither that he might not be forced to send soldiers, and run
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the risk of all that might arise from such a movement. What of this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: invasion, then, than which nothing could be less consistent with his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: plans? I wondered. It was possible that the travelling merchants, before
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whom I had played at treason, had reported the facts; and that on this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the Commandant at Auch had acted. But it seemed unlikely since he had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had his orders too, and under the Cardinal's rule there was small place
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for individual enterprise. Frankly I could not understand it, and found
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: only one thing clear; I might now enter the village as I pleased.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I am going on to look into this,' I said to Antoine. 'Come, my man.' He
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shrugged his shoulders, and stood still.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Not I!' he answered, with an oath. 'No soldiers for me I have lain out
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: one night, and I can lie out another.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I nodded indifferently, for I no longer wanted him; and we parted. After
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: this, twenty minutes' riding brought me to the entrance of the village,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and here the change was great indeed. Not one of the ordinary dwellers
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in the place was to be seen: either they had shut themselves up in their
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hovels, or, like Antoine, they had fled to the woods. Their doors were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: closed, their windows shuttered. But lounging about the street were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a score of dragoons, in boots and breastplates, whose short-barrelled
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: muskets, with pouches and bandoliers attached, were piled near the inn
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: door. In an open space, where there was a gap in the street, a long row
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of horses, linked head to head, stood bending their muzzles over bundles
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of rough forage; and on all sides the cheerful jingle of chains and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bridles and the sound of coarse jokes and laughter filled the air.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: As I rode up to the inn door an old sergeant, with squinting eyes and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his tongue in his cheek, scanned me inquisitively, and started to cross
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the street to challenge me. Fortunately, at that moment the two knaves
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whom I had brought from Paris with me, and whom I had left at Auch to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: await my orders, came up. I made them a sign not to speak to me, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: they passed on; but I suppose that they told the sergeant that I was not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the man he wanted, for I saw no more of him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: After picketing my horse behind the inn--I could find no better stable,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: every place being full--I pushed my way through the group at the door,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and entered. The old room, with the low, grimy roof and the reeking
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: floor, was half full of strange figures, and for a few minutes I stood
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unseen in the smoke and confusion. Then the landlord came my way, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as he passed me I caught his eye. He uttered a low curse, dropped the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pitcher he was carrying, and stood glaring at me like a man possessed.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The soldier whose wine he was carrying flung a crust in his face,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Now, greasy fingers! What are you staring at?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'The devil!' the landlord muttered, beginning to tremble.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then let me look at him!' the man retorted, and he turned on his stool.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He started, finding me standing over him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'At your service!' I said grimly. 'A little time and it will be the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: other way, my friend.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: CHAPTER VII. A MASTER STROKE
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I have a way with me which commonly commands respect; and when the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: landlord's first terror was over and he would serve me, I managed to get
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my supper--the first good meal I had had in two days--pretty comfortably
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in spite of the soldiers' presence. The crowd, too, which filled the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: room, soon began to melt. The men strayed off in groups to water their
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horses, or went to hunt up their quarters, until only two or three were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: left. Dusk had fallen outside; the noise in the street grew less. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: firelight began to glow and flicker on the walls, and the wretched room
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to look as homely as it was in its nature to look. I was pondering for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the twentieth time what step I should take next, and questioning why
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the soldiers were here, and whether I should let the night pass before
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I moved, when the door, which had been turning on its hinges almost
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: without pause for an hour, opened again, and a woman came in.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She paused a moment on the threshold looking round, and I saw that she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had a shawl on her head and a milk-pitcher in her hand, and that her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: feet and ankles were bare. There was a great rent in her coarse stuff
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: petticoat, and the hand which held the shawl together was brown and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dirty. More I did not see: for, supposing her to be a neighbour stolen
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in, now that the house was quiet, to get some milk for her child or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the like, I took no farther heed of her. I turned to the fire again and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: plunged into my thoughts.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But to get to the hearth where the goodwife was fidgeting the woman had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to pass in front of me; and as she passed I suppose that she stole a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: look at me from under her shawl. For just when she came between me and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the blaze she uttered a low cry and shrank aside--so quickly that she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: almost stepped on the hearth. The next moment she turned her back to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me, and was stooping whispering in the housewife's ear. A stranger might
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have thought that she had trodden on a hot ember.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But another idea, and a very strange one, came into my mind; and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood up silently. The woman's back was towards me, but something in her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: height, her shape, the pose of her head hidden as it was by her shawl,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seemed familiar. I waited while she hung over the fire whispering, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while the goodwife slowly filled her pitcher out of the great black pot.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But when she turned to go, I took a step forward so as to bar her way.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And our eyes met.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I could not see her features; they were lost in the shadow of the hood.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I saw a shiver run through her from head to foot. And I knew then
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that I had made no mistake.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is too heavy for you, my girl,' I said familiarly, as I might have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: spoken to a village wench. 'I will carry it for you.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: One of the men, who remained lolling at the table, laughed, and the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: other began to sing a low song. The woman trembled in rage or fear; but
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she kept silence and let me take the jug from her hands; and when I went
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the door and opened it, she followed mechanically. An instant, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the door fell to behind us, shutting off the light and glow, and we two
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood together in the growing dusk.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is late for you to be out, Mademoiselle,' I said politely. 'You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might meet with some rudeness, dressed as you are. Permit me to see you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: home.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She shuddered, and I thought that I heard her sob, but she did not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answer. Instead, she turned and walked quickly through the village in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the direction of the Chateau, keeping in the shadow of the houses. I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: carried the pitcher and walked close to her, beside her; and in the dark
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I smiled. I knew how shame and impotent rage were working in her. This
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was something like revenge!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Presently I spoke.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well, Mademoiselle,' I said, 'where are your grooms?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She gave me one look, her eyes blazing with anger, her face like hate
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: itself; and after that I said no more, but left her in peace, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: contented myself with walking at her shoulder until we came to the end
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the village, where the track to the great house plunged into the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wood. There she stopped, and turned on me like a wild creature at bay.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What do you want?' she cried hoarsely, breathing as if she had been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: running.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'To see you safe to the house,' I answered coolly. 'Alone you might be
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: insulted.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And if I will not?' she retorted.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'The choice does not lie with you, Mademoiselle,' I answered sternly,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You will go to the house with me, and on the way you will give me an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: interview--late as it is; but not here. Here we are not private enough.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We may be interrupted at any moment, and I wish to speak to you at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: length.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'At length?' she muttered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes, Mademoiselle.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I saw her shiver. 'What if I will not?' she said again.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I might call to the nearest soldiers and tell them who you are,' I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answered coolly. 'I might do that, but I should not. That were a clumsy
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: way of punishing you, and I know a better way. I should go to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Captain, Mademoiselle, and tell him whose horse is locked up in the inn
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stable. A trooper told me--as someone had told him--that it belonged
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to one of his officers; but I looked through the crack, and I knew the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse again.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She could not repress a groan. I waited; still she did not speak.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Shall I go to the Captain?' I said ruthlessly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She shook the hood back from her face and looked at me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Oh, you coward! you coward!' she hissed through her teeth. 'If I had a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: knife!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: therefore, to make up your mind which it is to be. Am I to go with my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: news to the captain, or am I to come with you?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Give me the pitcher,' she said harshly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I did so, wondering. In a moment she flung it with a savage gesture far
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: into the bushes.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Come!' she said, 'if you will. But some day God will punish you!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Without another word she turned and entered the path through the trees,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I followed her. I suppose that every one of its windings, every
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hollow and broken place in it had been known to her from childhood, for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she followed it swiftly and unerringly, barefoot as she was. I had to
title: Under the Red Robe

text: walk fast through the darkness to keep up with her. The wood was quiet,
title: Under the Red Robe

text: but the frogs were beginning to croak in the pool, and their persistent
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lights of the house. All the windows were bright. Doubtless the troopers

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: way.'
title: Under the Red Robe

text: where you are! It poisons me!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: had to come yourself and get food for him?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: matter. You remember the afternoon when I followed you--clumsily and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seeming that happened about a month ago. I believe that it happened the
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of your jewels is that you on your part recall those names.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'How?' she muttered. 'I do not understand.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'They are yours. They are not mine. They are nothing to me. Take them,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: Mademoiselle.'

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: than I know already,' I answered in a low voice. 'I do not wish to be in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that affair. But yes; there is one thing I have not mentioned. You are
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: right.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She sighed so deeply that I caught the sound.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is,' I continued slowly, 'that you will permit me to remain at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: there are twenty men and two officers quartered in your house. Your
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: brother is away. I ask to be permitted, Mademoiselle, to take his place
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for the time, and to be privileged to protect your sister and yourself
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from insult. That is all.'

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She raised her hand to her head. After a long pause,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'The frogs!' she muttered, 'they croak! I can not hear.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: walked over the bridge, leaving me standing there. For a moment I stood
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: aghast, peering after her shadowy figure, and wondering what had taken
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her. Then, in a minute or less, she came quickly back to me, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: understood. She was crying.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'None, Mademoiselle.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She had drawn the shawl over her head, and I no longer saw her face.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is all you ask?' she murmured.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is all I ask--now,' I answered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is granted,' she said slowly and firmly. 'Forgive me if I seem to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gratitude. I am in a dream; God grant that it may pass as a dream!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We are sunk in trouble. But for you and what you have done, M. de
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: barefoot, and I have kept you here.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is nothing,' she said in a voice which thrilled me. 'My heart is
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: warm, Monsieur--thanks to you. It is many hours since it has been as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: warm.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John
