title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: CHAPTER X. CLON
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You!' she cried, in a voice which pierced my heart. 'You are M. de
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Berault? It is impossible!' But, glancing askance at her--I could not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: face her I saw that the blood had left her cheeks.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes, Mademoiselle,' I answered in a low tone. 'De Barthe was my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mother's name. When I came here, a stranger, I took it that I might
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not be known; that I might again speak to a good woman, and not see
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her shrink. That, and--but why trouble you with all this?' I continued
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: rebelling, against her silence, her turned shoulder, her averted face.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You asked me, Mademoiselle, how I could take a blow and let the striker
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: go. I have answered. It is the one privilege M. de Berault possesses.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then,' she replied almost in a whisper, 'if I were M. de Berault, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would avail myself of it, and never fight again.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'In that event, Mademoiselle,' I answered coldly, 'I should lose my men
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: friends as well as my women friends. Like Monseigneur the Cardinal, rule
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: by fear.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She shuddered, either at the name or at the idea my words called up;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and, for a moment, we stood awkwardly silent. The shadow of the sundial
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fell between us; the garden was still; here and there a leaf fluttered
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: slowly down. With each instant of that silence, of that aversion, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: felt the gulf between us growing wider, I felt myself growing harder;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I mocked at her past which was so unlike mine; I mocked at mine, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: called it fate. I was on the point of turning from her with a bow--and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with a furnace in my breast--when she spoke.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'There is a last rose lingering there,' she said, a slight tremor in her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: voice. 'I cannot reach it. Will you pluck it for me, M. de Berault?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I obeyed her, my hand trembling, my face on fire. She took the rose from
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me, and placed it in the bosom of her dress, And I saw that her hand
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: trembled too, and that her cheek was dark with blushes.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She turned without more ado, and began to walk towards the house.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Heaven forbid that I should misjudge you a second time!' she said in a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hour ago I would have killed that man had I possessed the power.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You repented, Mademoiselle,' I said huskily. I could scarcely speak.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Do you never repent?' she said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes. But too late, Mademoiselle.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Perhaps it is never too late,' she answered softly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Alas, when a man is dead--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You may rob a man of worse than life!' she replied with energy,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stopping me by a gesture. 'If you have never robbed a man--or a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: woman--of honour! If you have never ruined boy or girl, M. de Berault!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: If you have never pushed another into the pit and gone by it yourself!
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: If--but, for murder? Listen. You are a Romanist, but I am a Huguenot,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and have read. "Thou shall not kill!" it is written; and the penalty,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ones to offend, it were better for you that a mill-stone were hanged

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: temptations. How do I know what you have suffered?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Where a man has not lied, nor betrayed, nor sold himself or others,'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she answered in a low tone, 'I think I can forgive all else. I can
title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: 'Mademoiselle?' I said softly. 'Is it you?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Clon?' she muttered, her voice quivering. 'What of him?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He is past pain,' I answered gently. 'He is dead--yes, dead,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Mademoiselle, but in his own way. Take comfort.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She stifled a sob; then before I could say more, the Lieutenant, with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his sergeant and light, were at my elbow. He saluted Mademoiselle
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: roughly. She looked at him with shuddering abhorrence.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I nodded.
title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: think that she prayed for Clon, though she was a Huguenot. Meanwhile,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had a fright. The lanthorn, swinging in the sergeant's hand, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: throwing its smoky light now on the stone seat, now on the rough
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wall above it, showed me something else. On the seat, doubtless where
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: watching and shivering, stood a pitcher of food. Beside her, in that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eye should fall upon it, lest the sergeant should see it; and then, in a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was doom. My throat grew dry as I listened; my tongue stuck to my mouth
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I tried to look at Mademoiselle, but I could not.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is true that the Captain is gone,' he said stiffly, 'but others
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: are alive, and about one of them a word with you, by your leave,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Mademoiselle. I have listened to a good deal of talk from this fine
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gentleman friend of yours. He has spent the last twenty-four hours
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: saying "You shall!" and "You shall not!" He came from you and took a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: very high tone because we laid a little whip-lash about that dumb devil
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of yours. He called us brutes and beasts, and but for him I am not sure
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that my friend would not now be alive. But when he said a few minutes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ago that he was glad--glad of it, d--him!--then I fixed it in my mind
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that I would be even with him. And I am going to be!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What do you mean?' Mademoiselle asked, wearily interrupting him. 'If
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: you think that you can prejudice me against this gentleman--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he answered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Wait! Wait, Mademoiselle---until you have heard,' he said. 'For I swear
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: trod the earth, it is this fellow! And I am going to expose him. Your
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: own eyes and your own ears shall persuade you. I am not particular, but
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: him! Ay, I would, so help me Heaven!'

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And the Lieutenant, turning squarely on his heel, spat on the ground.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: CHAPTER XI. THE ARREST
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It had come, and I saw no way of escape. The sergeant was between us
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I could not strike him. And I found no words. A score of times I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had thought with shrinking how I should reveal my secret to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Mademoiselle--what I should say, and how she would take it; but in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mind it had been always a voluntary act, this disclosure, it had been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: always I who unmasked myself and she who listened--alone; and in this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: voluntariness and this privacy there had been something which took from
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the shame of anticipation. But here--here was no voluntary act on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my part, no privacy, nothing but shame. And I stood mute, convicted,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: speechless, under her eyes--like the thing I was.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Yet if anything could have braced me it was Mademoiselle's voice when
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she answered him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Go on, Monsieur,' she said calmly, 'you will have done the sooner.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You do not believe me?' he replied. 'Then, I say, look at him! Look at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him! If ever shame--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Monsieur,' she said abruptly--she did not look at me, 'I am ashamed of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: myself.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But you don't hear me,' the Lieutenant rejoined hotly. 'His very name
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: is not his own! He is not Barthe at all. He is Berault, the gambler, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: duellist, the bully; whom if you--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Again she interrupted him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I know it,' she said coldly. 'I know it all; and if you have nothing
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more to tell me, go, Monsieur. Go!' she continued in a tone of infinite
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: scorn. 'Be satisfied, that you have earned my contempt as well as my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: abhorrence.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He looked for a moment taken aback. Then,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ay, but I have more,' he cried, his voice stubbornly triumphant.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I forgot that you would think little of that. I forgot that a swordsman
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: has always the ladies' hearts---but I have more. Do you know, too, that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he is in the Cardinal's pay? Do you know that he is here on the same
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: errand which brings us here--to arrest M. de Cocheforet? Do you know
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that while we go about the business openly and in soldier fashion, it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: is his part to worm himself into your confidence, to sneak into Madame's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: intimacy, to listen at your door, to follow your footsteps, to hang on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: your lips, to track you--track you until you betray yourselves and the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: man? Do you know this, and that all his sympathy is a lie,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Mademoiselle? His help, so much bait to catch the secret? His aim
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: blood-money--blood-money? Why, MORBLEU!' the Lieutenant continued,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pointing his finger at me, and so carried away by passion, so lifted
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: out of himself by wrath and indignation, that I shrank before him--'you
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: talk, lady, of contempt and abhorrence in the same breath with me, but
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: what have you for him--what have you for him--the spy, the informer, the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hired traitor? And if you doubt me, if you want evidence, look at him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Only look at him, I say.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And he might say it; for I stood silent still, cowering and despairing,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: white with rage and hate. But Mademoiselle did not look. She gazed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: straight at the Lieutenant.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Have you done?' she said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Done?' he stammered; her words, her air, bringing him to earth again.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Done? Yes, if you believe me.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I do not,' she answered proudly. 'If that be all, be satisfied,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Monsieur. I do not believe you.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then tell me this,' he retorted, after a moment of stunned surprise.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Answer me this! Why, if he was not on our side, do you think that we
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: let him remain here? Why did we suffer him to stay in a suspected house,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bullying us, annoying us, thwarting us, taking your part from hour to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hour?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'MILLE DIABLES!' he cried, snapping his fingers in a rage. 'That for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his sword! It was because he held the Cardinal's commission, I tell you,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: because he had equal authority with us. Because we had no choice.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And that being so, Monsieur, why are you now betraying him?' she asked.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He swore at that, feeling the stroke go home.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: path.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The sergeant went after him, the lanthorn swaying in his hand. And we
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: two were left alone. The frogs were croaking in the pool, a bat flew
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: round in circles; the house, the garden, all lay quiet under the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And would to Heaven I had never come that was the cry in my heart. Would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: continual shame to me; a reproach branding me every hour I stood in her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: presence with all vile and hateful names. The man just gone, coarse,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: low-bred, brutal soldier as he was, manflogger and drilling-block, had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: silent and absorbed near the stone seat, a shadowy figure with face
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: he had said, and out of these scraps piecing together the damning truth?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to her and touched her sleeve.

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She started violently, and turned.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Pardon, Monsieur!' she murmured, passing her hand over her brow; 'I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forgotten that you were here. Do I believe what?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: heaving.

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: the corners and towards the door. 'There is no one here.'

title: Under the Red Robe

text: before her, the statue of despair. Had she felt a grain of suspicion, a

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: instinct, and following all its turns and twists, until we came to the
title: Under the Red Robe

text: 'Then come,' I whispered rising. 'I have seen what I want. Let us go.'

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But he caught me by the arm and detained me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You don't know the way,' he said. 'Steady, steady, Monsieur. You go
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: too fast. They are just moving. Let us join them, and strike in when the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: time comes. We must let them guide us.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: are on the road to it.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lights began to move. The Lieutenant was starting. The moon was not yet
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: up, the sky was grey and cloudy; to advance where we were was to step
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: into a wall of blackness. But we had lost too much already, and I did
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not hesitate. Bidding my companion follow me and use his legs, I sprang
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: through a low fence which rose before us; then stumbling blindly over
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: recklessly and up the farther side, and, breathless and panting,
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the noise we made. We were in no danger of being noticed, and in a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: twinkling we turned our backs, and as fast as we could we ran down the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: road. Fortunately, they were thinking more of secrecy than speed, and in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a minute we had doubled the distance between them and us. In two minutes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: even the tramp of their feet. Then I began to look out and go more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: slowly, peering into the shadows on either side for the fernstack.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On one hand the hill rose steeply, on the other it fell away to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stream. On neither side was close wood, or my difficulties had been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: immensely increased; but scattered oak trees stood here and there among
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the bracken. This helped me, and presently, on the upper side, I came
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: upon the dense substance of the stack looming black against the lighter
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hill.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: My heart beat fast, but it was no time for thought. Bidding the man in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a whisper to follow me and be ready to back me up, I climbed the bank
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: softly, and, with a pistol in my hand, felt my way to the rear of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the stack, thinking to find a hut there, set against the fern, and M.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cocheforet in it. But I found no hut. There was none; and, moreover, it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was so dark now we were off the road, that it came upon me suddenly,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as I stood between the hill and the stack, that I had undertaken a very
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: difficult thing. The hut behind the fern stack. But how far behind? how
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: far from it? The dark slope stretched above us, infinite, immeasurable
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shrouded in night. To begin to climb it in search of a tiny hut,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: possibly well hidden and hard to find in daylight, seemed an endeavour
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as hopeless as to meet with the needle in the hay! And now while I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood, chilled and doubting, almost despairing, the steps of the troop
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in the road began to grow audible, began to come nearer.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Well, Monsieur le Capitaine?' the man beside me muttered--in wonder why
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stood. 'Which way? or they will be before us yet.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I tried to think, to reason it out; to consider where the hut should be;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while the wind sighed through the oaks, and here and there I could hear
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: an acorn fall. But the thing pressed too close on me; my thoughts would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: not be hurried, and at last I said at a venture,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Up the hill. Straight up from the stack.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He did not demur, and we plunged at the ascent, knee-deep in bracken and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: furze, sweating at every pore with our exertions, and hearing the troop
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: come every moment nearer on the road below. Doubtless they knew exactly
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whither to go! Forced to stop and take breath when we had scrambled up
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fifty yards or so, I saw their lanthorns shining like moving glow-worms;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I could even hear the clink of steel. For all I could tell, the hut
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might be down there, and we be moving from it. But it was too late to go
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: back now--they were close to the fern-stack; and in despair I turned
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to the hill again. A dozen steps and I stumbled. I rose and plunged on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: again; again stumbled. Then I found that I was treading level earth.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And--was it water I saw before me, below me? or some mirage of the sky?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Neither; and I gripped my fellow's arm, as he came abreast of me, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stopped him sharply. Below us in the middle of a steep hollow, a pit in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the hill-side, a light shone out through some aperture and quivered on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the mist, like the pale lamp of a moorland hobgoblin. It made itself
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: visible, displaying nothing else; a wisp of light in the bottom of a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: black bowl. Yet my spirits rose with a great bound at sight of it; for I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: knew that I had stumbled on the place I sought.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In the common run of things I should have weighed my next step
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: carefully, and gone about it slowly. But here was no place for thought,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: nor room for delay; and I slid down the side of the hollow on the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: instant, and the moment my feet touched the bottom sprang to the door of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the little hut, whence the light issued. A stone turned under my feet
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in my rush, and I fell on my knees on the threshold; but the fall only
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: brought my face to a level with the face of the man who lay inside on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a bed of fern. He had been reading. Startled by the sound I made, he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dropped his book, and in a flash stretched out his hand for a weapon.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But the muzzle of my pistol covered him, he was not in a posture from
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which he could spring, and at a sharp word from me he dropped his hand;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was tired of it.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: kill you. But you have still a choice.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Truly?' he said, raising his eyebrows.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: you, and you go as a prisoner.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What force have you?' he asked curtly. He still lay on his elbow, his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cloak covering him, the little Marot in which he had been reading close
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to his hand. But his quick black eyes, which looked the keener for the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pallor and thinness of his face, roved ceaselessly over me, probed the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: darkness behind me, took note of everything.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Enough to compel you, Monsieur,' I replied sternly; 'but that is not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all. There are thirty dragoons coming up the hill to secure you, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: they will make you no such offer. Surrender to me before they come, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: give me your parole, and I will do all I can for your comfort. Delay,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and you must fall into their hands. There can be no escape.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You will take my word?' he said slowly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Give it, and you may keep your pistols, M. de Cocheforet.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Tell me at least that you are not alone.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I am not alone.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then I give it,' he said with a sigh. 'And for Heaven's sake get me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: something to eat and a bed. I am tired of this pig-sty. MON DIEU! it is
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a fortnight since I slept between sheets.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You shall sleep to-night in your own house, if you please,' I answered
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hurriedly. 'But here they come. Be good enough to stay where you are for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a moment, and I will meet them.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stepped out into the darkness, just as the Lieutenant, after posting
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his men round the hollow, slid down with a couple of sergeants to make
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the arrest. The place round the open door was pitch-dark. He had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: espied my man, who had lodged himself in the deepest shadow of the hut,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and when he saw me come out across the light he took me for
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: triumphantly,--'You are my prisoner!' while one of the sergeants raised
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a lanthorn and threw its light into my eyes.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What folly is this?' I said savagely.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The Lieutenant's jaw fell, and he stood for a moment paralysed with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: astonishment. Less than an hour before he had left me at the Chateau.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Thence he had come hither with the briefest delay; yet he found me here
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before him. He swore fearfully, his face black, his moustachios stiff
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with rage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What is this? What is it?' he cried. 'Where is the man?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What man?' I said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'This Cocheforet!' he roared, carried away by his passion. 'Don't lie to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me! He is here, and I will have him!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You are too late,' I said, watching him heedfully. 'M. de Cocheforet is
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: here, but he has already surrendered to me, and is my prisoner.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Your prisoner?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Certainly!' I answered, facing the man with all the harshness I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: muster. 'I have arrested him by virtue of the Cardinal's commission
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: granted to me. And by virtue of the same I shall keep him.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You will keep him?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I shall!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He stared at me for a moment, utterly aghast; the picture of defeat.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Then on a sudden I saw his face lighten with, a new idea.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is a d--d ruse!' he shouted, brandishing his pistol like a madman.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is a cheat and a fraud! By God! you have no commission! I see
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: through it! I see through it all! You have come here, and you have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hocussed us! You are of their side, and this is your last shift to save
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What folly is this?' I said contemptuously.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No folly at all,' he answered, perfect conviction in his tone. 'You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have played upon us. You have fooled us. But I see through it now. An
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hour ago I exposed you to that fine Madame at the house there, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thought it a marvel that she did not believe me. I thought it a marvel
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that she did not see through you, when you stood there before her,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: confounded, tongue-tied, a rogue convicted. But I understand now. She
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: knew you. She was in the plot, and you were in the plot, and I, who
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thought that I was opening her eyes, was the only one fooled. But it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: is my turn now. You have played a bold part and a clever one,' he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: continued, a sinister light in his little eyes,' and I congratulate you.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But it is at an end now, Monsieur. You took us in finely with your talk
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of Monseigneur, and his commission and your commission, and the rest.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I am not to be blinded any longer--or bullied. You have arrested

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him, have you? You have arrested him. Well, by G--, I shall arrest him,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I shall arrest you too.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You are mad!' I said staggered as much by this new view of the matter
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as by his perfect certainty. 'Mad, Lieutenant.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I was,' he snarled. 'But I am sane now. I was mad when you imposed upon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: us, when you persuaded me to think that you were fooling the women to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: get the secret out of them, while all the time you were sheltering them,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: protecting them, aiding them, and hiding him--then I was mad. But not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: now. However, I ask your pardon. I thought you the cleverest sneak and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thought, and an honest traitor. Your pardon.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: looked at the Lieutenant and could willingly have killed him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: scarcely speak. 'Do you say that I am an impostor--that I do not hold
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

text: But I saw that he was choking with emotion; he had just parted from his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wife, and I turned away.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: When we were all mounted he looked at me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Perhaps--as you have my parole, you will permit me to ride alone?' he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said with a little hesitation. 'And--'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Without me!' I rejoined keenly. 'Assuredly, so far as is possible.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Accordingly I directed the troopers to ride before him, keeping out of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: earshot, while my two men followed him at a little distance with their
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: carbines on their knees. Last of all, I rode myself with my eyes open
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and a pistol loose in my holster. M. de Cocheforet muttered a sneer at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so many precautions and the mountain made of his request; but I had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: done so much and come so far, I had not faced scorn and insults to be
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cheated of my prize at last; and aware that until we were beyond Auch
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: there must be hourly and pressing danger of a rescue, I was determined
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that he who should wrest my prisoner from me should pay dearly for it.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Only pride, and, perhaps, in a degree also, appetite for a fight, had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: prevented me borrowing ten troopers instead of two.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: As was wont I looked with a lingering eye and many memories at the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: little bridge, the narrow woodland path, the first roofs of the village;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all now familiar, all seen for the last time. Up the brook a party of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: soldiers were dragging for the captain's body. A furlong farther on, a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cottage, burned by some carelessness in the night, lay a heap of black
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ashes. Louis ran beside us weeping; the last brown leaves fluttered down
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in showers. And between my eyes and all, the slow steady rain fell and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fell. And so I left Cocheforet.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Louis went with us to a point a mile beyond the village, and there stood
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and saw us go, cursing me furiously as I passed. Looking back when we
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had ridden on, I still saw him standing, and after a moment's hesitation
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I rode back to him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Listen, fool!' I said, cutting him short in the midst of his mowing and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: snarling, 'and give this message to your mistress. Tell her from me that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it will be with her husband as it was with M. de Regnier, when he fell
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: into the hands of his enemy--no better and no worse.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You want to kill her, too, I suppose?' he answered glowering at me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No, fool, I want to save her,' I retorted wrathfully. 'Tell her that,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: just that and no more, and you will see the result.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I shall not,' he said sullenly. 'A message from you indeed!' And he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: spat on the ground.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then on your head be it,' I answered solemnly, And I turned my horse's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: head and galloped fast after the others. But I felt sure that he would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: report what I had said, if it were only out of curiosity; and it would
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: be strange if Madame, a gentlewoman of the south, bred among old family
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: traditions, did not understand the reference.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And so we began our journey; sadly, under dripping trees and a leaden
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sky. The country we had to traverse was the same I had trodden on the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: last day of my march southwards, but the passage of a month had changed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the face of everything. Green dells, where springs welling out of the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: chalk had once made of the leafy bottom a fairies' home, strewn with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: delicate ferns and hung with mosses, were now swamps into which our
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horses sank to the fetlock. Sunny brews, whence I had viewed the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: champaign and traced my forward path, had become bare, wind-swept
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ridges. The beech woods that had glowed with ruddy light were naked now;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mere black trunks and rigid arms pointing to heaven. An earthy smell
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: filled the air; a hundred paces away a wall of mist closed the view.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We plodded on sadly up hill and down hill, now fording brooks, already
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stained with flood-water, now crossing barren heaths. But up hill or
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: down hill, whatever the outlook, I was never permitted to forget that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I was the jailor, the ogre, the villain; that I, riding behind in my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: loneliness, was the blight on all--the death-spot. True, I was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: behind the others--I escaped their eyes. But there was not a line of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Mademoiselle's figure that did not speak scorn to me; not a turn of head
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that did not seem to say, 'Oh, God, that such a thing should breathe.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had only speech with her once during the day, and that was on the last
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ridge before we went down into the valley to climb up again to Auch.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The rain had ceased; the sun, near its setting, shone faintly; for a few
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moments we stood on the brow and looked southwards while we breathed the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horses. The mist lay like a pall on the country we had traversed; but
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: beyond and above it, gleaming pearl-like in the level rays, the line
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the mountains stood up like a land of enchantment, soft, radiant,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wonderful!--or like one of those castles on the Hill of Glass of which
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the old romances tell us. I forgot for an instant how we were placed,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I cried to my neighbour that it was the fairest pageant I had ever
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seen.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She--it was Mademoiselle, and she had taken off her mask--cast one
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: look at me in answer; only one, but it conveyed disgust and loathing so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: unspeakable that scorn beside them would have been a gift. I reined in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my horse as if she had struck me, and felt myself go first hot and then
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cold under her eyes. Then she looked another way.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I did not forget the lesson; and after that I avoided her more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sedulously than before. We lay that night at Auch, and I gave M. de
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cocheforet the utmost liberty, even permitting him to go out and return
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: at his will. In the morning, believing that on the farther side of Auch
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: we ran little risk of attack, I dismissed the two dragoons, and an hour
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: after sunrise we set out again. The day was dry and cold, the weather
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more promising. I proposed to go by way of Lectoure, crossing the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Garonne at Agen; and I thought that, with roads continually improving
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: as we moved northwards, we should be able to make good progress before
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: night. My two men rode first, I came last by myself.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Our way lay down the valley of the Gers, under poplars and by long rows
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of willows, and presently the sun came out and warmed us. Unfortunately
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the rain of the day before had swollen the brooks which crossed our
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: path, and we more than once had a difficulty in fording them. Noon found
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: us little more than half way to Lectoure, and I was growing each minute
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more impatient when our road, which had for a little while left the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: river bank, dropped down to it again, and I saw before us another
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: crossing, half ford half slough. My men tried it gingerly and gave back
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and tried it again in another place; and finally, just as Mademoiselle
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and her brother came up to them, floundered through and sprang slantwise
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: up the farther bank.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The delay had been long enough to bring me, with no good will of my own,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: close upon the Cocheforets. Mademoiselle's horse made a little business
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the place, and in the result we entered the water almost together;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and I crossed close on her heels. The bank on either side was steep;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while crossing we could see neither before nor behind. But at the moment
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I thought nothing of this nor of her delay; and I was following her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: quite at my leisure and picking my way, when the sudden report of a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: carbine, a second report, and a yell of alarm in front thrilled me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: through.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: On the instant, while the sound was still in my ears, I saw it all. Like
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a hot iron piercing my brain the truth flashed into my mind. We were
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: attacked! We were attacked, and I was here helpless in this pit, this
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: trap! The loss of a second while I fumbled here, Mademoiselle's horse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: barring the way, might be fatal.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: There was but one way. I turned my horse straight at the steep bank, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he breasted it. One moment he hung as if he must fall back. Then, with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a snort of terror and a desperate bound, he topped it, and gained the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: level, trembling and snorting.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Seventy paces away on the road lay one of my men. He had fallen, horse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and man, and lay still. Near him, with his back against a bank, stood
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his fellow, on foot, pressed by four horsemen, and shouting. As my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eye lighted on the scene he let fly with a carbine, and dropped one.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I clutched a pistol from my holster and seized my horse by the head.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I might save the man yet, I shouted to him to encourage him, and was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: driving in my spurs to second my voice, when a sudden vicious blow,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swift and unexpected, struck the pistol from my hand.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I made a snatch at it as it fell, but missed it, and before I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: recover myself, Mademoiselle thrust her horse furiously against mine,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and with her riding-whip lashed the sorrel across the ears. As the horse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: reared up madly, I had a glimpse of her eyes flashing hate through her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mask; of her hand again uplifted; the next moment, I was down in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: road, ingloriously unhorsed, the sorrel was galloping away, and her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse, scared in its turn, was plunging unmanageably a score of paces
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But for that I think that she would have trampled on me. As it was, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was free to rise, and draw, and in a twinkling was running towards the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fighters. All had happened in a few seconds. My man was still defending
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: himself, the smoke of the carbine had scarcely risen. I sprang across
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a fallen tree that intervened, and at the same moment two of the men
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: detached themselves and rode to meet me. One, whom I took to be the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: leader, was masked. He came furiously at me to ride me down, but I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: leaped aside nimbly, and, evading him, rushed at the other, and scaring
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his horse, so that he dropped his point, cut him across the shoulder,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before he could guard himself. He plunged away, cursing and trying to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hold in his horse, and I turned to meet the masked man.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You villain!' he cried, riding at me again. This time he manoeuvred his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse so skilfully that I was hard put to it to prevent him knocking
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me down; while I could not with all my efforts reach him to hurt him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Surrender, will you?' he cried, 'you bloodhound!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I wounded him slightly in the knee for answer; before I could do more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his companion came back, and the two set upon me, slashing at my head so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: furiously and towering above me with so great an advantage that it was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all I could do to guard it. I was soon glad to fall back against the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: bank. In this sort of conflict my rapier would have been of little
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: use, but fortunately I had armed myself before I left Paris with a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cut-and-thrust sword for the road; and though my mastery of the weapon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was not on a par with my rapier play, I was able to fend off their cuts,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and by an occasional prick keep the horses at a distance. Still, they
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swore and cut at me; and it was trying work. A little delay might enable
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the other man to come to their help, or Mademoiselle, for all I knew,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: might shoot me with my own pistol. I was unfeignedly glad when a lucky
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: parade sent the masked man's sword flying across the road. On that he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pushed his horse recklessly at me, spurring it without mercy; but the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: animal, which I had several times touched, reared up instead, and threw
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him at the very moment that I wounded his companion a second time in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: arm, and made him give back.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The scene was now changed. The man in the mask staggered to his feet,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and felt stupidly for a pistol. But he could not find one, and he was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in no state to use it if he had. He reeled helplessly to the bank
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and leaned against it. The man I had wounded was in scarcely better
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: condition. He retreated before me, but in a moment, losing courage,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: let drop his sword, and, wheeling round, cantered off, clinging to his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pommel. There remained only the fellow engaged with my man, and I turned
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to see how they were getting on. They were standing to take breath, so
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I ran towards them; but on seeing me coming, this rascal, too, whipped
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: round his horse and disappeared in the wood, and left us victors.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The first thing I did--and I remember it to this day with pleasure--was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to plunge my hand into my pocket, take out half of all the money I had
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in the world, and press it on the man who had fought for me so stoutly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: In my joy I could have kissed him! It was not only that I had escaped
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: defeat by the skin of my teeth--and his good sword; but I knew, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: felt, and thrilled with the knowledge, that the fight had, in a sense,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: redeemed my character. He was wounded in two places, and I had a scratch
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: or two, and had lost my horse; and my other poor fellow was dead as a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: herring. But, speaking for myself, I would have spent half the blood in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my body to purchase the feeling with which I turned back to speak to M.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: de Cocheforet and his sister. Mademoiselle had dismounted, and with her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: face averted and her mask pushed on one side, was openly weeping.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Her brother, who had faithfully kept his place by the ford from the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: beginning of the fight to the end, met me with raised eyebrows and a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: peculiar smile.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Acknowledge my virtue,' he said airily. 'I am here, M. de Berault;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: which is more than can be said of the two gentlemen who have just ridden
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: off.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes,' I answered with a touch of bitterness. 'I wish that they had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: shot my poor man before they went.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He shrugged his shoulders.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'They were my friends,' he said. 'You must not expect me to blame them.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But that is not all, M. de Berault.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'No,' I said, wiping my sword. 'There is this gentleman in the mask.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And I turned to go towards him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'M. de Berault!' Cocheforet called after me, his tone strained and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: abrupt.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stood. 'Pardon?' I said, turning.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That gentleman?' he said, hesitating and looking at me doubtfully.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Have you considered what will happen to him if you give him up to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: authorities?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Who is he?' I asked sharply.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is rather a delicate question,' he answered frowning.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Not for me,' I replied brutally, 'since he is in my power. If he will
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: take off his mask I shall know better what I intend to do with him.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The stranger had lost his hat in his fall, and his fair hair, stained
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with dust, hung in curls on his shoulders. He was a tall man, of a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: slender, handsome presence, and, though his dress was plain and almost
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: rough, I espied a splendid jewel on his hand, and fancied that I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: detected other signs of high quality. He still lay against the bank in a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: half-swooning condition, and seemed unconscious of my scrutiny.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Should I know him if he unmasked?' I said suddenly, a new idea in my

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'There is a third road,' I answered. 'It leads to Paris. That is my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: road, Mademoiselle. We part here.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But why?' she cried wildly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Because from to-day I would fain begin to be honourable,' I answered in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a low voice. 'Because I dare not be generous at another's cost. I must
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: go back whence I came.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'To the Chatelet?' she muttered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes, Mademoiselle, to the Chatelet.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She tried feverishly to raise her mask with her hand.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I am not well,' she stammered. 'I cannot breathe.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And she began to sway so violently in her saddle that I sprang down,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and, running round her horse's head, was just in time to catch her as
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she fell. She was not quite unconscious then, for as I supported her,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: she cried out,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Do not touch me! Do not touch me! You kill me with shame!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But as she spoke she clung to me; and I made no mistake. Those words
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: made me happy. I carried her to the bank, my heart on fire, and laid her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: against it just as M. de Cocheforet rode up. He sprang from his horse,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: answer. I dashed the spurs into my horse, and rode away past the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
