text: CHAPTER XIV. ST MARTIN'S EVE
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was late evening on the twenty-ninth of November when I rode into
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Paris through the Orleans gate. The wind was in the north-east, and a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: great cloud of vapour hung in the eye of an angry sunset. The air seemed
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to be heavy with smoke, the kennels reeked, my gorge rose at the city's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: smell; and with all my heart I envied the man who had gone out of it by
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the same gate nearly two months before, with his face to the south and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the prospect of riding day after day and league after league across
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: heath and moor and pasture. At least he had had some weeks of life
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before him, and freedom and the open air, and hope and uncertainty;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while I came back under doom, and in the pall of smoke that hung over
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the huddle of innumerable roofs saw a gloomy shadowing of my own fate.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: For make no mistake. A man in middle life does not strip himself of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the worldly habit with which experience has clothed him, does not run
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: counter to all the hard saws and instances by which he has governed his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: course so long, without shiverings and doubts and horrible misgivings,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and struggles of heart. At least a dozen times between the Loire and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Paris I asked myself what honour was, and what good it could do me when
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I lay rotting and forgotten; if I were not a fool following a Jack o'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Lanthorn; and whether, of all the men in the world, the relentless man
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to whom I was returning would not be the first to gibe at my folly?
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: However, shame kept me straight; shame and the memory of Mademoiselle's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: looks and words. I dared not be false to her again; I could not, after
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: speaking so loftily, fall so low, And therefore--though not without many
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a secret struggle and quaking--I came, on the last evening but one of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: November, to the Orleans gate, and rode slowly and sadly through the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: streets by the Luxembourg on my way to the Pont au Change.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: The struggle had sapped my last strength, however; and with the first
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whiff of the gutters, the first rush of barefooted gamins under my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: horse's hoofs, the first babel of street cries--the first breath, in a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: word, of Paris--there came a new temptation; to go for one last night to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Zaton's, to see the tables again and the faces of surprise, to be for an
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hour or two the old Berault. That would be no breach of honour, for in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: any case I could not reach the Cardinal before to-morrow. And it could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: do no harm. It could make no change in anything. It would not have been
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a thing worth struggling about, indeed; only--only I had in my inmost
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: heart a suspicion that the stoutest resolutions might lose their force
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in that atmosphere; and that there even such a talisman as the memory of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a woman's looks and words might lose its virtue.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Still, I think that I should have succumbed in the end if I had not
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: received at the corner of the Luxembourg a shock which sobered me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: effectually. As I passed the gates, a coach, followed by two outriders,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: swept out of the Palace courtyard; it was going at a great pace, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I reined my jaded horse on one side to give it room. By chance as it
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whirled by me, one of the leather curtains flapped back, and I saw for a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: second by the waning light--the nearer wheels were no more than two feet
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from my boot--a face inside.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: A face and no more, and that only for a second. But it froze me. It was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Richelieu's, the Cardinal's; but not as I had been wont to see it--keen,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: cold, acute, with intellect and indomitable will in every feature. This
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: face was contorted with the rage of impatience, was grim with the fever
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of haste, and the fear of death. The eyes burned under the pale brow,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the moustache bristled, the teeth showed through the beard; I could
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fancy the man crying 'Faster! Faster!' and gnawing his nails in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: impotence of passion; and I shrank back as if I had been struck. The
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: next moment the outriders splashed me, the coach was a hundred paces
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ahead, and I was left chilled and wondering, foreseeing the worst, and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: no longer in any mood for Zaton's.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Such a revelation of such a man was enough to appal me, for a moment
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: conscience cried out that he must have heard that Cocheforet had escaped
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him, and through me. But I dismissed the idea as soon as formed. In the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: vast meshes of the Cardinal's schemes Cocheforet could be only a small
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fish; and to account for the face in the coach I needed a cataclysm, a
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: catastrophe, a misfortune as far above ordinary mishaps as this man's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: intellect rose above the common run of minds.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: It was almost dark when I crossed the bridges, and crept despondently to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the Rue Savonnerie. After stabling my horse I took my bag and holsters,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and climbing the stairs to my old landlord's--I remember that the place
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had grown, as it seemed to me, strangely mean and small and ill-smelling
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in my absence--I knocked at the door. It was promptly opened by the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: little tailor himself, who threw up his arms and opened his eyes at
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sight of me.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'By Saint Genevieve!' he said, 'if it is not M. de Berault?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is,' I said. It touched me a little, after my lonely journey,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to find him so glad to see me; though I had never done him a greater
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: benefit than sometimes to unbend with him and borrow his money. 'You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: look surprised, little man!' I continued, as he made way for me to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: enter. 'I'll be sworn that you have been pawning my goods and letting
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my room, you knave!' 'Never, your Excellency!' he answered. 'On the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: contrary, I have been expecting you.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'How?' I said. 'To-day?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'To-day or to-morrow,' he answered, following me in and closing the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: door. 'The first thing I said when I heard the news this morning
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was--now we shall have M. de Berault back again. Your Excellency will
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pardon the children,' he continued, bobbing round me, as I took the old
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seat on the three-legged stool before the hearth. 'The night is cold and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: there is no fire in your room.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: While he ran to and fro with my cloak and bags, little Gil, to whom
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I had stood at St Sulpice's, borrowing ten crowns the same day, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: remember, came shyly to play with my sword hilt.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'So you expected me back when you heard the news, Frison, did you?' I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said, taking the lad on my knee.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'To be sure, your Excellency,' he answered, peeping into the black pot
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before he lifted it to the hook.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Very good. Then now let us hear what the news is,' I said drily.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Of the Cardinal, M. de Berault.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ah! And what?' He looked at me, holding the heavy pot suspended in his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hands.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You have not heard?' he exclaimed in astonishment.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Not a tittle. Tell it me, my good fellow.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You have not heard that his Eminence is disgraced?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I stared at him. 'Not a word,' I said.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He set down the pot.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Then your Excellency must have made a very long journey indeed,' he
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: said with conviction. 'For it has been in the air a week or more, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thought that it had brought you back. A week? A month, I dare say. They
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: whisper that it is the old Queen's doing. At any rate, it is certain
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that they have cancelled his commissions and displaced his officers.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: There are rumours of immediate peace with Spain. Everywhere his enemies
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: are lifting up their heads; and I hear that he has relays of horses set
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all the way to the coast that he may fly at any moment. For what I know
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: he may be gone already.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But, man--' I said, surprised out of my composure. 'The King! You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: forget the King. Let the Cardinal once pipe to him and he will dance.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And they will dance too!' I added grimly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes,' Frison answered eagerly. 'True, your Excellency, but the King
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: will not see him. Three times to-day, as I am told, the Cardinal
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: has driven to the Luxembourg and stood like any common man in the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ante-chamber, so that I hear it was pitiful to see him. But his Majesty
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would not admit him. And when he went away the last time I am told that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his face was like death! Well, he was a great man, and we may be worse
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ruled, M. de Berault, saving your presence. If the nobles did not like
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him, he was good to the traders and the bourgeoisie, and equal to all.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Silence, man! Silence, and let me think,' I said, much excited. And
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: while he bustled to and fro, getting my supper, and the firelight
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: played about the snug, sorry little room, and the child toyed with his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: plaything, I fell to digesting this great news, and pondering how I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: stood now and what I ought to do. At first sight, I know, it seemed to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me that I had nothing to do but to sit still. In a few hours the man
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: who had taken my bond would be powerless, and I should be free; in a few
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: hours I might smile at him. To all appearance the dice had fallen well
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for me. I had done a great thing, run a great risk, won a woman's love;
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But a word which fell from Frison as he fluttered round me, pouring out
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the broth and cutting the bread, dropped into my mind and spoiled my
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: satisfaction.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes, your Excellency,' he said, confirming something he had stated
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: before and which I had missed, 'and I am told that the last time he came
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his levee last Monday would speak to him. They fell off like
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: rats--just like rats--until he was left standing alone. And I have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: seen him!'--Frison lifted up his eyes and his hands and drew in his
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: breath--'Ah! I have seen the King look shabby beside him! And his eye! I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: would not like to meet it now.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Pish!' I growled. 'Someone has fooled you. Men are wiser than that.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'So? Well, your Excellency understands,' he answered meekly. 'But--there
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: are no cats on a cold hearth.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I told him again that he was a fool. But for all that, and my reasoning,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I felt uncomfortable. This was a great man, if ever a great man lived,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and they were all leaving him; and I--well, I had no cause to love him.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But I had taken his money, I had accepted his commission, and I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had betrayed him. These three things being so, if he fell before I

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: courage.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And yet the flesh was weak. A day, twenty-four hours, two days, might
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: light I was awake, and it was all I could do to keep myself quiet until
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: going.
title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

title: Under the Red Robe

text: along several passages, and everywhere found the same silence, the same
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: monastic stillness. At length, while I was dolefully considering whether
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the Bastille or the Chatelet would be my fate, he stopped at a door,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thrust the letter into my hands, and lifting the latch, signed to me to
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: enter.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I went in in amazement, and stopped in confusion. Before me, alone, just
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: risen from a chair, with her face one moment pale, the next crimson with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: blushes, stood Mademoiselle de Cocheforet. I cried out her name.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'M. de Berault,' she said, trembling. 'You did not expect to see me?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I expected to see no one so little, Mademoiselle,' I answered, striving
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to recover my composure.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yet you might have thought that we should not utterly desert you,' she
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: replied, with a reproachful humility which went to my heart. 'We should
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have been base indeed, if we had not made some attempt to save you.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I thank Heaven, M. de Berault, that it has so far succeeded that that
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: strange man has promised me your life. You have seen him?' she continued
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eagerly and in another tone, while her eyes grew on a sudden large with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fear.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Yes, Mademoiselle,' I said. 'I have seen him, and it is true, He has
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: given me my life.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And sent me into imprisonment.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'For how long?' she whispered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I do not know,' I answered. 'I fear during the King's pleasure.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She shuddered.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'I may have done more harm than good,' she murmured, looking at me
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: piteously. 'But I did it for the best. I told him all, and perhaps I did
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: harm.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: But to hear her accuse herself thus, when she had made this long and
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lonely journey to save me, when she had forced herself into her enemy's
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: presence, and had, as I was sure she had, abased herself for me, was
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: more than I could bear.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Hush, Mademoiselle, hush!' I said, almost roughly. 'You hurt me. You
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: have made me happy; and yet I wish that you were not here, where, I
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: fear, you have few friends, but back at Cocheforet. You have done more
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: for me than I expected, and a hundred times more than I deserved. But
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: it must end here. I was a ruined man before this happened, before I ever
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: saw you. I am no worse now, but I am still that; and I would not have
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: your name pinned to mine on Paris lips. Therefore, good-bye. God forbid
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I should say more to you, or let you stay where foul tongues would soon
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: malign you.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She looked at me in a kind of wonder; then, with a growing smile,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'It is too late,' she said gently.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Too late?' I exclaimed. 'How, Mademoiselle?'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Because--do you remember, M. de Berault, what you told me of your
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: love-story under the guide-post by Agen? That it could have no happy
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ending? For the same reason I was not ashamed to tell mine to the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Cardinal. By this time it is common property.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I looked at her as she stood facing me. Her eyes shone under the lashes
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that almost hid them. Her figure drooped, and yet a smile trembled on
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her lips.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'What did you tell him, Mademoiselle?' I whispered, my breath coming
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: quickly.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That I loved,' she answered boldly, raising her clear eyes to mine.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'And therefore that I was not ashamed to beg--even on my knees.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I fell on mine, and caught her hand before the last word passed her
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: lips. For the moment I forgot King and Cardinal, prison and the future,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: all; all except that this woman, so pure and so beautiful, so far above
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me in all things, loved me. For the moment, I say. Then I remembered
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: myself. I stood up, and stood back from her in a sudden revulsion of
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: feeling.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'You do not know me!' I cried, 'You do not know what I have done!'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'That is what I do know,' she answered, looking at me with a wondrous
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: smile.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Ah! but you do not!' I cried. 'And besides, there is this--this between
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: us.' And I picked up the Cardinal's letter. It had fallen on the floor.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: She turned a shade paler. Then she cried quickly,--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Open it! open it! It is not sealed nor closed.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I obeyed mechanically, dreading with a horrible dread what I might see.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Even when I had it open I looked at the finely scrawled characters with
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: eyes askance. But at last I made it out. And it ran thus:--
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'THE KING'S PLEASURE IS THAT M. GIL DE BERAULT, HAVING MIXED HIMSELF UP
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: IN AFFAIRS OF STATE, RETIRE FORTHWITH TO THE DEMESNE OF COCHEFORET, AND
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: CONFINE HIMSELF WITHIN ITS LIMITS UNTIL THE KING'S PLEASURE BE FURTHER
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: KNOWN.
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'THE CARDINAL DE RICHELIEU.'
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: We were married next day, and a fortnight later were at Cocheforet, in
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the brown woods under the southern mountains; while the great Cardinal,
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: once more triumphant over his enemies, saw with cold, smiling eyes the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: world pass through his chamber. The flood tide of his prosperity lasted
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: thirteen years from that time, and ceased only with his death. For the
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: world had learned its lesson; to this hour they call that day, which saw
title: Under the Red Robe
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me stand alone for all his friends, 'The Day of Dupes.'
